title:Cobes-3's Reduced MNK Wishlist.
description:This is a reduced wishlist that removes controller specific rolls from 48klocs voltron file and JustAnotherTeam's wishlist. It also sorts rolls with tags to the top.


// Albedo Wing PvE first-choice roll
// auxilliary Reserves, Low-Impedence Windings, Appended Mag, Grave Robber, Field Prep, Close To Melee
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of bulkier Minor, and Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Only the second Aggressive Glaive subtype so there's not much of a comparison to make, but Albedo Wing seems to have decent stats. The range is good, so you can focus on the shield duration stat with the haft perk for major damage reduction in PvE. Although the reload speed is also poor, we can bypass that with traits, so Appended Mag ups mag size by one. In the first trait column, Grave Robber procs on glaive melees, or Field prep boosts reserves, and reload speed when crouched, and Close to Melee in the second boosts melee damage by 30% for a projectile hit. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Shield Duraction, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,1087426260,1631667848,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=2713678205,1087426260,1631667848,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,1087426260,2869569095,1782407750
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=2713678205,1087426260,2869569095,1782407750

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Cold Steel
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies and Champions in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. But it has a trick that now other sword can do - the Cold Steel trait perk. For single target damage, the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. As your trait perk combination, both Relentless Strikes and Cold Steel proc off three hits, with the first two Cold Steel hits Stasis slowing and the third hit freezing enemies. That covers Overload and Unstoppable Champions. Throw on Radiant from a solar subclass to cover Barriers too, and you have the sword equivalent of Riptide which will freeze lock Majors with every third hit, and which you can apply Stasis subclass fragments too as well. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3650930298
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3650930298

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For single target damage it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one for boss damage, yet the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. For burst damage, Relentless Strikes returns ammo on every third hit and Whirlwind Blade can quickly boost damage by 30% after 10 hits. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Unrelenting, Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Collective Action
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For add clearing, it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one yet for add clearing, the a mag boosting blade slot perk keeps you slashing for longer. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes return ammo, or Unrelenting recovers health. In the second, you could use Chain Reaction for the explosions to help clear adds, or Surrounded or Collective Action for additional damage to help clear bulkier Minor spec and the occasional Major spec enemies. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Indebted Kindness PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Lead From Gold, Beacon Rounds, Loose Change, Permeability
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. ??? 106909392 2420895100 1087426260 ???: First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies particularly for Void Gyrfalcon Hunters in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. The new-to-Season 23 Permeability trait in the second trait column means, if you're running Gyrfalcons, you can use Indebted Kindness to apply volatility at will - making this really strong against Barrier Champions as well as for add clear. You can pair this with Lead From Gold to help with ammo economy, Beacond Rounds for strong enemy tracking or Loose Change for speedy reloads, if you're using Gambler's Dodge. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Loaded Question PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, will trigger Reservoir Burst in the second trait slot as the signature perk, a Chain Reaction-type explosions on kills to clear adds, and +25% damage to burst down Majors and maybe the occasional boss DPS phase. Plus you can build into the Arc 3.0 blinding and jolting verb kit with an arc subclass, making this a bit of a PvE Swiss-Army Knife. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Loaded Question Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, will trigger Reservoir Burst in the second trait slot as the signature perk, a Chain Reaction-type explosions on kills to clear adds, and +25% damage to burst down Majors and maybe the occasional boss DPS phase. Plus you can build into the Arc 3.0 blinding and jolting verb kit with an arc subclass, making this a bit of a PvE Swiss-Army Knife. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Messenger PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Under-Over, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Anti-barrier Champion use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For use against Barrier Champions, Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage to shields and barrier, which is boosted a further 10% with Under-Over in the first trait slot as the support perk. In the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits or four bursts, damaging the stunned Champion and any adds within 5m. If you're running solo content, don't forget the Alacrity origin trait to pretty much max out every stat on the board, and add 10 Aim Assist too. Recommended MW: any will work, depending on your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3796795102&perks=839105230,1968497646,1870851715,3891536761

// The Messenger Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Under-Over, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Anti-barrier Champion use in end-game activities. The reprised Messenger has a few new tricks for Season 21, which make it worth a look. Good stats across the board, except for recoil direction, which we can help out with Arrowhead Brake in the barrel slot, which takes it to a controllable 90. For use against Barrier Champions, Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage to shields and barrier, which is boosted a further 10% with Under-Over in the first trait slot as the support perk. In the second slot, the new-for-Lightfall Kinetic Tremors as the signature perk adds bonus AoE damage for 12 hits or four bursts, damaging the stunned Champion and any adds within 5m. dimwishlist:item=364665267&perks=839105230,1968497646,1870851715,3891536761

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strike, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for for Majors and Bosses. No second origin trait, but Dawning Surprise helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so - ideal in keeping you alive in CQC. In the blade slot, Jagged Edge to maximises damage or Tempered Edge balances a bit of extra damage and ammo, for all-round utility. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation in the guard slot, to get your heavy attack up as quickly as possible. For groups and single target damage, Relentless Strikes helps with your ammo economy, while Whirldwind Blade builds up to 30% bonus damage after 10 hits - great for chunkier Minor add clear or a Major or Boss.. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=396910433&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for building into Arc 3.0 subclasses. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. You want to make your reloads as fast as possible, so Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag are you mag choices. In the first trait column, Perpetual Motion boosts Reload Speed even more so that when you get your first add kill, you can reload as fast as possible to proc Jolt with Voltshot in the second column for additional damage against a Major or Boss and add clear of any Minors nearby. This is as close as you'll get to a legendary Cloudstrike. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-boss, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,3230963543,1428297954,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,106909392,1428297954,2173046394

// Mindbender's Ambition PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Lead From Gold, Auto-Loading Holster, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for solar subclasses in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good solar shotgun that does the same job. There's a few barrel perk options - Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud for more handling, or Smallbore for a bit more range. In the mag, Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are two solid choices. Then, in the trait columns You could use Threat Detector, Lead From Gold or Auto-Loading Holster to pair with Incandescent to use scorch and ignition to clear groups of adds or help with damage to Majors. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Mindbender's Ambition Adept PvE first-choice roll

// Taipan-4fr PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap, Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against majors and Champions in end-game content. Shapeable. An end-game LFR that you don't need to complete a Raid, Dungeon or Trials for, which works for both burst and sustained damage, especially with the Veist Stinger origin trait throwing in extra shots for free at random. A Handling barrel just makes using it snappier, and Enhanced Battery adds a shot with no downsides, to give the origin trait an extra chance to proc. For solo or against more mobile bosses, take your choice of Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap or Field Prep with Frenzy, so you don't need to worry about how close your are to the rest of your fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Defiance of Yasmin PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Barrel, Lead From Gold, Firing Line, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats, plus the lowest Zoom in class. Add Handling with the barrel, and then maximise your mag size with Extended Mag and Backup Mag together. Lead From Gold means you only have to run Power Ammo finders and scavengers so you'll have plenty of ammo for use against Majors and Champions, with the added damage from Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Qullim's Terminus PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Stats For All, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Go all-in for mag size with Extended Mag to boost the benefits from the origin perk to get you close to 100 shots without reloading. Stats for All helps with gunfell and for when you finally do need to reload, but the real joy is in the Swiss-Army knife benefits of Killing Tally - three kills gets you a 30% damage buff with no time limit for the rest of the huge magazine or until stowed - better than either Firing Line or Focused Fury can offer - good for ripping through Minor adds, burst damage against Majors or even sustained damage against Bosses. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1321506184&perks=1392496348,2420895100,1583705720,557221067

dimwishlist:item=1321506184&perks=1840239774,2420895100,1583705720,557221067

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles. High-ish stats make this fairly competitive in slot if you don't look too closely at Heritage, anyway. You can never go wrong with a bit more range from your barrel, and faster fire rate, or an extra round in the mag and better reload speed. For endgame content, Triple Tap keeps the bullets coming, and Surrounded provides a huge boost to CQC damage, complimenting the origin perk, and will help with damage against champions when the mod is in town. //notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 30. PvE backup roll for end-game content. Another opportunity to get a kinetic Blinding Grenade Launcher, if you haven't already - an essential tool in any end-game toolbox. Unfortunately, Danger Zone has been lost in its re-issued format, so there's no complementary trait in the last column. You'll be swapping back and forth, so go for a handling barrel. Obviously Blinding Grenades in the mag, and then Auto-Loading Holster to reload while you're mopping up your blinded enemies with your Energy weapon. // Retold Tale PvE backup roll
// Full Choke, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE backup roll for end-game content. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, with the update 4.1.5 buff to pellet shotguns. // The Call First-choice PvE
// Quick Launch, Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator, Tactical Mag, High-Velocity Rounds, High-Explosive Ordnance, Subsistence, Lead from Gold, One for All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Minor and Major add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. The Call is the best weapon to come from the Pale Heart weapon set. There's only one other rocket-assisted frame, so there's not much to compare against, but the stats don't honestly matter. You'd normally look for velocity in a non-hitscan weapon, but there's an argument to be made for blast radius too so the barrel and mag perk choices depend on your preference although be aware that High-Explosive Ordnance will reduce the base mag size to 9. This is going to one-hit kill red bars in most content, so Subsistence is a good choice to bypass reloading entirely, or Lead from Gold will help with the already good ammo economy in the first trait perk column. In the second, One for All can proc from AoE damage ticks - which is why you might want to focus on blast radius - for +35% bonus damage for 10s. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Velocity or Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Call First-choice PvE
// Quick Launch, Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator, Tactical Mag, High-Velocity Rounds, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Minor and Major add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. The Call is the best weapon to come from the Pale Heart weapon set. There's only one other rocket-assisted frame, so there's not much to compare against, but the stats don't honestly matter. You'd normally look for velocity in a non-hitscan weapon, but there's an argument to be made for blast radius too so the barrel and mag perk choices depend on your preference. In the first trait perk column, Demolitionist boosts grenade energy on kills, which you can pair with the traditional Adrenaline Junkie for +33% damage or Desperate Measures which is easy to proc with Prismatic for up to +30% in the second column. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Velocity or Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Someday First-choice PvE
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, TacticalMag, Threat Detector, Lead from Gold, Threat Remover, Recombination
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst DPS against Majors and Champions in end-game content. Shapeable. Someday has in-band stats and is the only kinetic precision frame shotgun currently available. As per usual, Look for handling, or a touch of extra range without any penalties in the barrel perk, and Assault Mag or maybe Tactical Mag in the magazine slot. As the support perk in the first trait column, Threat Detector and Lead for Gold are viable options, or the new Threat Remover looks interesting. Then in the second column, this is the only non-Raid shotgun, and the first pellet shotgun, that can roll with Recombination, which adds up to +100% damage to the next shot, ideal for tanky enemies. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag or Quick Access Sling mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Axial Lacuna First-choice PvE
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Accelerated Coils, Enhanced Battery, Reconstruction, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for backup DPS against Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. If you don't already have a fusion rifle for backup DPS, Axial Lacuna is available and shapeable. If you're interested, a lacuna is a gap or blank space, so the name refers to something missing in the direction of an axis. Improve your handling with your barrel perk, and then with your battery, Accelerated Coils is probably the top choice, but there's also something to be said for the extra shots you'll get from Enhanced Battery. there's nothing better than Reconstruction in the first trait perk slot, doubling your battery's capacity for a damage phase. In the second trait slot, Controlled Burst is the go-to trait for bonus damage, both adding +20% damage and reducing charge time for just landing all your bolts. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Pro Memoria First-choice PvE
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Demolitionist, Desperate Measures, Collective Action, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the 	 to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, Ricichet Rounds helps a little more with recoil control, or you can use High-Caliber or Armor-Piercing Rounds for additional combat effects. As a "heavy scout rifle" for add clearing, it never hurts to have a bigger mag, so you can use Reconstruction or Envious Assassin in the first trait slot, and then Desperate Measures is easy to proc with Transcendent for up to +30% damage, you should be creating plenty of strand tangles to proc Collective Action's +20% damage, or Frenzy is a reliable +15% plus maxxed handling and reload speed. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Pro Memoria First-choice PvE
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Hatchling, Desperate Measures, Collective Action, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in end-game content, particularly with Strand fragments. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the barrel perk to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, for sustained boss damage, you'll want a perk that increases mag size or possibly helps a little more with recoil control. As a "heavy scout rifle" to use with Strand fragments, you should be getting easy headshot add kills to spawn threadlings with the Hatchling trait perk in the first column. Then Desperate Measures is easy to proc with Transcendent for up to +30% damage, you should be creating plenty of strand tangles to proc Collective Action's +20% damage, or Frenzy is a reliable +15% plus maxxed handling and reload speed. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// False Idols First-choice PvE
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Bait and Switch, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts damage. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. Then, in the first trait perk slot, Relentless Strikes passively returns ammo on hits while, in the second, Bait and Switch adds +30% damage when procced, or in the right circumstances, Surrounded adds +35% damage +41.75% when enhanced. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// False Idols First-choice PvE
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Incandescent, Chain Reaction, One for All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content, particularly with solar fragments. False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Shapeable. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts ammo count. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. Then, in the first trait perk slot, Incandescent is very good a clearing crowds, particularly with solar fragments that use scorch or ignite, and then Chain Reaction, while not great for damage with the poor sword damage multiplier, can spread scorch and soften up add-dense crowds, or One for All can boost damage by +35% for dealing with a smaller number of beefier enemies. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Shapeable. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts ammo count. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. In the first trait perk slot Relentless, particularly with solar fragments that bolster restoration, can keep you alive in CQC fight. Then, in the second slot, Chain Reaction, while not great for damage with the poor sword damage multiplier, can soften up add-dense crowds, or One for All can boost damage by +35% for dealing with a smaller number of beefier enemies. // Elsie's Rifle Shiny PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for tackling Barrier Champions in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. First, a little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots. Maybe a little niche, but add together Armor-Piercing Rounds, Under-Over and the extra damage from Frenzy, and you have a great option for piercing Barrier Champions. If the pulse rifle mod isn't around, Gyrfalcon Hunters can take advantage of on-demand volatile rounds to make this a year-round option. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-champion, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Succession Shiny PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damege against Major and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. First thing to say is if you already have the DSC raid version, you're already covered. If not, this is an excellent kinetic frame sniper rifle with pretty much best in-subfamily stats. The best rolls are more for burst damage against majors and stunned Champions. Fluted Barrel adds handling and stability, or go all-in to stability with Polygonal Rifling. You can use Tactical Mag to add stability and reload speed, or maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag and Backup Mag. For Majors, Reconstruction will double your magazine size so you can get up to 10 in the mag with Extended Mag and a Backup Mag mod, and Recombination give you an Izanagi-lite first shot with up to 100% bonus damage, Firing Line provides a passive 20% bonus crit damage in a fireteam or, if you're running solo, Focused Fury can proc after three crit his, so your remaining shots have 20% bonus damage, or Vorpal Weapon is just a straight 15% damage against Majors and Bosses. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Edge Transit Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Augmented Drum, Auto-Loading Holster, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The meme-machine is back and, although the stats are average, it's a beast for boss damage. Go for a barrel perk that boosts Velocity and Handling, and Augmented Drum as the mag park adds an extra shot. As the first trait perk, Auto-Loading Holster bypasses Augmented Drum's reload penalty or Field Prep just negates it, and Explosive Light adds +25% damage - when enhanced, this will apply to all 7 shots before reloading. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Falling Guillotine Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded, Bait and Switch, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for boss damage, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts impact, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the first trait column, Frenzy provides the largest passive damage bonus of +15%, but Vorpal Weapon is still +10% or the old classic Relentless Strikes will extend sword ammo. In the second trait column, Surrounded provides +35% damage +42% when enhanced but only when in a crowd, or both Bait and Switch and Whirlwind Blade provide +30% when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Boss, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Falling Guillotine Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Frenzy, Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Sword Logic, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for add clearing, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts reserves, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the first trait column, Frenzy provides the largest passive damage bonus of +15%, or there's the option of Chain Reaction even if the combatant damage scaling means it's not as much fun as other weapon types. In the second trait column, Surrounded provides +35% damage +42% when enhanced when procced - which should be a lot if you're clearing adds, but there's also Desperate Measures and Sword Logic, which boost damage on kills, so you can chew through beefier adds too. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Falling Guillotine Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Repulsor Brace, Chain Reaction, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for add clearing, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts reserves, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the trait columns, for void fragment synergy, Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds grants any easy void overshield - handy for CQC work - on kills of adds made volatile on kills. If you're not so worried about the overshield, Chain Reaction can help spread Destabilizing Rounds volatility further through the death explosions in ad-dense areas. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Falling Guillotine PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Frenzy, Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Sword Logic, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for add clearing, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts reserves, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the first trait column, Frenzy provides the largest passive damage bonus of +15%, or there's the option of Chain Reaction even if the combatant damage scaling means it's not as much fun as other weapon types. In the second trait column, Surrounded provides +35% damage +42% when enhanced when procced - which should be a lot if you're clearing adds, but there's also Desperate Measures and Sword Logic, which boost damage on kills, so you can chew through beefier adds too. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. The Other Half returns with a few new perks, so if you haven't got one yet Dares of Eternity awaits! Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. While Eager Edge was the unique Dares perk back in the day, it's appeared elsewhere since so Relentless Strikes is probably the more sensible first column trait perk to combine with Surrounded in the second for 35% 41.8% when enhanced bonus damage when in a crowd. The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for boosting charge time and guarding stats when you first swap to it. // The Slammer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Slammer is our first vortex frame Stasis sword, with the same stats as its peers. Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For boss damage, the combination of Relentless Strikes and Bait and Switch has you covered, adding 30% damage for 10s. You'll probably find more use for the Vanguard's Vindication origin trait, unless there's a champion mod around for swords that works with Stunning Recovery. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// A Sudden Death PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Envious Assassin, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Minor and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. A Sudden Death returns as void, rather than arc shotgun with the rather poor stats you'd expect from a Year 1 gun. If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. If you are making do, then Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling pad out the Handling stats a little as the barrel perk, and Assault Mag speeds up shots, or Tactical Mag adds one to the mag as the magazine perk. You could take your choice of either Threat Detector's Handling and Reload buffs or Envious Assassin for an overflowed magazine to start an engagement with. Trench Barrel bumps up damage by 50% for three shots when procced - although you'll obviously need to be right up close to take advantage! The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// A Sudden Death PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Full Choke, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Envious Assassin, One-Two Punch

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Minor and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. A Sudden Death returns as void, rather than arc shotgun with the rather poor stats you'd expect from a Year 1 gun. If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. If you are making do, then Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling pad out the Handling stats a little, or Full Choke tightens the pellet spread as the barrel perk, and Assault Mag speeds up shots, or Tactical Mag adds one to the mag as the magazine perk. You could take your choice of either Threat Detector's Handling and Reload buffs or Envious Assassin for an overflowed magazine to start an engagement with. One-Two Punch doubles melee damage when procced for fast burst damage against majors and champions. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Crux Termination IV PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Clown Cartridge, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major or Boss spec enemies in end-game content. As an aggressive RL, Crux Termination IV is in the highest damage category of rocket launchers, along with adaptive-frames, and has the highest velocity in its peer group to boot. You can look on the low blast radius as an advantage for boss fights, as you can get a bit closer without being killing yourself in the explosion. There's no Field Prep option, so you start off with 1 in the mag and 7 reserves, with one more rocket for each chest ammo reserve mod. Go for the highest velocity you can with the barrel perk and then, for boss damage, Impact Casing is always the best option. In the first trait column, you could look at Envious Assassin - up to three in the tube after 11 kills with other weapons. Alternatively Reconstruction passively provides 2 in the tube over the course of 8s, or Clown Cartridge does the same on a manual reload. For major or boss damage, Explosive Light provides up to 6 shots with +25% damage. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Crux Termination IV PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Clown Cartridge, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. As an aggressive RL, Crux Termination IV is in the highest damage category of rocket launchers, along with adaptive-frames, and has the highest velocity in its peer group to boot. You can look on the low blast radius as an advantage for boss fights, as you can get a bit closer without being killing yourself in the explosion. With one eye on Bipod as the second column trait, as there's no Field Prep option, you'll start off with 2 in the mag and 12 reserves, with one more rocket for each chest ammo reserve mod. Go for the highest velocity you can with the barrel perk and then, for boss damage, Impact Casing is always the best option. In the first trait column, you could look at Envious Assassin - up to five in the tube after 11 kills with other weapons. Alternatively Reconstruction passively provides 4 in the tube at the rate of one every 4s, or Clown Cartridge provides 3 or 4 after a manual reload. For burst and sustained Boss damage, Bipod just about breaks even with 25% less damage and slower reloads, but faster firing and more reserve ammo. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Burst Guard, Balanced Guard, Cross Counter, Counterattack
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies, or Boss spec enemies with short damage windows in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. Jagged Edge provides the most damage as a Blade perk, but decimates your ammo, so Honed Edge and Tempered Edge might be attractive alternatives. For this roll, you'll be looking to block damage, so a Guard perk like Burst Guard or Balanced Guard works best. This is the only sword dropping in S23 with the combination of Flash Counter and Counterattack - get in close to a tanky enemy to bait them into a melee/slam attack, and then the combination of weaken and bonus damage provides +80% damage for 2s, and +20% for the next two, which should be enough time to put a serious dent in their health bar. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Boss, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=938542991,52780822,2244851822,3016987351

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Auto-Loading Holster, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. For burst damage against majors, the trait combination of Auto-Loading Holster and Trench Barrel is decent enough. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Pugilist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. For burst damage against majors, there's the well-established trait combination of Pugilist, to recover melee energy and Swashbuckler for up to a +33% damage boost after a melee kill. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Supercluster PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Fourth Time's the Charm, Reconstruction, Thread Detector, Lead From Gold, Surrounded, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Supercluster is the first Strand pinpoint slug shotgun, and the good news is it has very competitive stats. The bad news is that they're not as great as they were a few years ago for boss DPS, but you might want to keep one just in case, if you don't have a slug shotty already. Use the barrel perk to boost range and the mag perk to improve its utility - your preference between Assault Mag or Tactical Mag, or Appended Mag. If you're looking for a backup DPS weapon, then a reloading perk in the first trait column - Fourth Time's The Charm, Reconstruction, Threat Detector, or Lead From Gold for you ammo economy are all possible. For a damage boosting perk in the second trait slot, choose between Surrounded, if you're likely to be in CQC with extra adds, or Vorpal Weapon for a reliable 15% boost to damage against Majors and Bosses. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Lead from Gold, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage to Major Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for melee builds. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Full Choke keeps the pellet spread tighter, or Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Tactical Mag or Assault Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. If you don't already have a One-Two Punch Shotgun, then this can work - Lead From Gold to keep your ammo topped off, or Slideshot for instant slide reloads in the first trait column to support One-Two Punch in the second to pair with an aggressive melee-focussed build for burst damage against Majors, including stunned Champions. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Albedo Wing PvE first-choice roll
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content with an arc subclass. Only the second Aggressive Glaive subtype so there's not much of a comparison to make, but Albedo Wing seems to have decent stats. The range is good, so you can focus on the shield duration stat with the haft perk for major damage reduction in PvE. The reload speed is poor, and Light Mag is the only perk that helps. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge can overflow the magazine on reload to 5 or 6, and there are plenty of arc grenades the glaive melee doesn't count unfortunately, to proc the second stack of Golden Tricorn with for a 50% damage boost for 10s. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Shield Duraction, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=580685494,679225683,2284787283,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=2680976411&perks=2713678205,679225683,2284787283,2610012052

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Full Bore, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Controlled Burst
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec or Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Controlled Burst in the second trait slot for DPS that'll hold up as a burst damage weapon against Majors or a backup weapon for boss damage phases. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Shield Diraction, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Smallbore, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Overflow, Controlled Burst

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against crowds of Minor adds or Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Controlled Burst in the second trait slot for 10% faster charge time and 20% bonus damage DPS that'll hold up as a burst damage weapon against Majors or a backup weapon for boss damage phases. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. // Glacioclasm PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Smallbore, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Extended Battery, Overflow, Reservoir Burst
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against crowds of Minor adds or Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk, although don't be put off by pretty much any barrel. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Reservoir Burst - which works for all overflowed rounds in the battery - to both burst down Majors with 25% bonus damage and help crowd control groups of adds with exploding corpses. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, One For All
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing chunkier Minor Spec, and Major Spec enemies in end-game content. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Appended Mag, Extended Mag or Flared Magwell can all work as mag perks. Finally, the SOFA Stats/ One For All traint combination layers on more useful stats and a chunky 35% damage boost for 10s when procced. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Zephyr PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, HonedEdge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Zephyr's stats are much like any other adaptive sword, except the DSC raid-drop Bequest. For single target damage it doesn't really do anything that other swords don't already cover, but if you don't have one yet for boss damage, the additional damage from Jagged Edge is the best choice, although Honed Edge and Tempered Edge are decent alternatives. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation for swords, but don't discount other guards that help with guarding stats as you'll be up close and will probably need the damage resistance. For burst damage, Relentless Strikes returns ammo on every third hit and Surrounded boosts damage by 35% if there are enemies nearby - this can be useful in crowded boss fights. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1911078836&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3708227201

// originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep90-warlords-ruin-weapons.txt

@title:Season 23 Warlord's Ruin weapons
@description:New weapons dropping from the Warlord's Ruin dungeon, with the Sundering origin trait

// Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Slice, Precision Instrument
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for support against Major and Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Slice in the first trait column and Precision Instrument in the second could make for an interesting combination to apply Sever to majors and bosses from range - even when they're immune to damage - to reduce their damage output by 40% for 10s or 15s with Thread of Continuity effectively a 40% DR for the whole fireteam as well as doing decent, for a primary weapon, damage with the boost from Precision Instrument. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3827198035,923806249,555281244
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3429800428,923806249,555281244

// Naeem's Lance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, Slice
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for against Major or Boss Spec enemies, particularly with Strand subcalsses, in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Naeem's Lance is no exception, having pretty good overall stats. It's the first Rapid-fire Sniper so, as is common for most snipers, Handling is a crucial stat but, as this is a rapid-fire frame, you'll also need to tidy up the recoil direction, so Arrowhead Brake is the barrel perk choice, taking the stat to a manageable 84. As the mag perk, Tactical Mag is the best option, as it boosts stability a bit too, and gives the same rounds in the mag seven as Appended and Extended Mag, but either of those work too. For the first trait, Reconstruction doubles your mag size passively, while Slice in the second trait makes this possibly the best special weapon to pair with a Bait and Switch heavy weapon - reducing the Severed target's damage output by 40% for 10s 15s with Thread of Continuity if you're using a Strand subclass - an effective additional 40% DR for your whole fireteam. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,106909392,1523832109,923806249
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,923806249
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,2420895100,1523832109,923806249

// Indebted Kindness PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Impulse Amplifier, Loose Change, Voltshot
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies particularly for Arc subclasses in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. Voltshot, as the second trait perk, should make it easy to apply Jolt to a target and help clear adds quickly, but relies on a fast reload - Impulse Amplifier as the first trait perk helps all the time or, after your first application of Voltshot, Loose Change boosts reload speed by 50. Throw on other fragments like Spark of Beacons for additional blinding to suppress adds, or Ions/Discharge to feed your abilities and this could be a top choice for crowd control. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Indebted Kindness PvE backup roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Lead From Gold, Beacon Rounds, Adagio
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Major Spec enemies particularly for Arc subclasses in end-game content. Indebted Kindness is the first ever Rocket-Assisted Frame sidearm, so there's no comparison possible. It seems to be a weird mix of sidearm and grenade launcher, which hits like a truck. Blast Radius seems to be the most impactful stat so any of the barrel perks that help boost it are viable. For similar reasons, High-Explosive Ordnance is the top choice for the mag perk. As the second trait perk, Adagio is a net damage increase after a kill, even with the slower firing rate, so pair that with Lead From Gold to keep the ammo flowing, or the new to Season 23 Beacon Rounds for strong enemy tracking. Throw on other fragments like Spark of Beacons for additional blinding to suppress adds, or Ions/Discharge to feed your abilities and this could be a top choice for crowd control. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself.
