// Dragoncult Sickle PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Slice, Surrounded, Whirlwind Blade
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies particularly for Strand subclasses in end-game content. This is the first new Caster-Frame sword we've seen in some time, and the first Strand one. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Dragoncult Sickle is no exception, having pretty good overall stats - both Impact and Ammo Capacity are higher than its peers. The advantage you have with caster frames is that you can hit from range with the heavy attack, but the ammo cost as at v7.3.0.3 is still a little high. On the other hand, you can use it for major or boss damage - the standard Jagged Edge for the extra damage and Swordmaster's Guard for the Blade and Guard perks still apply. The new-to-Season-23 Slice as the first trait perk gives this an ability to sever a major or a boss, reducing its outgoing damage by 40% for 10s or 15s with Thread of Continuity, which can be a lifesaver in a CQC fight. In the second trait column as the signature perk, you could go for Surrounded, if you know there will be adds around to boost damage by 40%, or Whirlwind Blade if there aren't. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3668817296&perks=3666208348,269888150,923806249,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3668817296&perks=3666208348,269888150,923806249,3708227201

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Keep Away, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Mechabre it's so obviously a pun on Macabre, so let's just pronounce it Mech-ah-bruh is reportedly excellent in PvP, but like all aggressive snipers it struggles to find a role in PvE. One thing you could do is use it to apply jolt to beefier targets at a distance. As with most snipers, look for a handling-boosting barrel perk. Building towards the end, Flared Magwell gives the biggest boost to reload speed out of the magazine perks, with Tactical Mag a decent alternative. Keep Away in the first trait column as the support perk boosts reload speed by a further 30, as well as boosting range and accuracy all of which, with a reload Masterwork, can get the reload speed up to 85. Get one kill against an add, reload and then Voltshot in the second column as the signature perk can apply jolt to your next target from a safe distance for burst and AoE damage. The Search Party origin trait is more PvP-orientated, but faster ADS speed is always nice to have. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Acosmic PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. If you weren't around to shape your own Regnant, and don't have a decently-rolled Explosive Light grenade launcher, Acosmic named after one of the two Hindu aspects of god; to be acosmic is to deny the objective reality of the temporal world - transcendental in a world-negating sense, according to Merriam-Webster is a void rapid-fire frame GL, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty, and is a viable option. Use the barrel perk to get shots to the target as fast as possible, and Spike Grenades adds 13.3% to total damage for a direct hit in the magazine slot. In the first column, for the support trait perk, saves a reserves perk on your chest and significantly boosts reload when you crouch. Explosive Light is the second column as the signature perk adds +52.5% to total damage for up to six shots for great burst damage, as well as boosting the blast radius to 100 - great against Majors surrounded by minor adds. The Nadir Focus origin trait boosts your shot velocity further, which is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=413901114&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2869569095,3194351027

// Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Pugilist, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for melee builds and burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. In the barrel perk slot, Full Choke improves pellet spread which is important for later. For the mag perk, Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed or Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire. To make the most of the Cursed Thrall origin trait, which synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active, Pugilist is an obvious choice in the first trait column as the support perk, regenerating melee energy on weapon kills. In the second column as the signature perk, One-Two Punch is great for burst damage against a major or a champion, or even the occasional boss for melee-based builds. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

In the barrel perk slot, Full Choke improves pellet spread which is important for later. In the second column as the signature perk, One-Two Punch is great for burst damage against a major or a champion, or even the occasional boss for melee-based builds. // Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Subsistence, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. The same CQC condition will proc Surrounded for a +40% 47% on Enhanced Surrounded boost to damage to help clear the most subborn Minor and Major enemies, and help with the occasional Boss. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Subsistence, Sword Logic
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. In the second column, as the signature perk, the new-to-season-22 Sword Logic could be interesting on a shotgun - you should be able to proc a lower stack pretty easily, and use the damage boost to help activate the higher stacks. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Pugilist, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for melee builds and burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. In the barrel perk slot, Full Choke improves pellet spread which is important for later. For the mag perk, Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed or Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire. To make the most of the Cursed Thrall origin trait, which synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active, Pugilist is an obvious choice in the first trait column as the support perk, regenerating melee energy on weapon kills. In the second column as the signature perk, One-Two Punch is great for burst damage against a major or a champion, or even the occasional boss for melee-based builds. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Subsistence, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. For the mag perk, Assault Mag improves rate-of-fire or Tactical Mag increases the magazine by one and boosts reload speed. With a shotgun, you're going to be in CQC to proc Threat Detector as the first trait column support perk, to boost reload speed and handling or you could use Subsistence to continually reload your magazine as you get kills, if you're using this more for add-clear rather than single-target damage. The same CQC condition will proc Surrounded for a +40% 47% on Enhanced Surrounded boost to damage to help clear the most subborn Minor and Major enemies, and help with the occasional Boss. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. // Song of Ir Yt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Bait-and-Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies and sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. There's a lot of competition in the arc LMGs, and Song of Ir Yt has lower than average stats but saves itself with some nice trait perk combinations. Handling makes most weapons feel better - Fluted Barrel adds the most, but Arrowhead Brake also helps max out the recoil direction in the barrel perk slot. Maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag or Appended Mag as the perk, and then in the first column as the support perk, you can then make the most of this with Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction so you can essentially keep firing til you run out of ammo. With this set-up, you can use Bait-and-Switch as the second column signature perk for 10s of +35% damage, which is great for shorter boss damage phases think Caretaker in Vow. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2828278545&perks=1840239774,2420895100,3418782618,3078487919

// Deadpan Delivery PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Overflow, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major or Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Decent stats in comparison with its peers. So if you're a Lethal Current Hunter in the market for a shotgun to pair with your melee, Deadpan Delivery is a very decent choice. For a One-Two Punch roll, start with Full Choke, to make hitting all your pellets a little easier. Tactical Mag increases the magazine to a maximum of 5 which is the same as Appended and Extended Mags. Then, as the first trait column support perk, there's no Grave Robber unfortunately, but Overflow doubles your magazine size for picking up ammo, which gives you 10 shots before you'll have to reload unless you pickup another ammo brick. Finally, One-Two Punch in the second column as the signature perk boosts your powered melee damage by a hefty 40%. You probably won't get much use out of the Nadir Focus Origin Trait, which adds range and accuracy on repeated hits, but it is nice to have anyway. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1047830412,106909392,3643424744,2679249093
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1047830412,1087426260,3643424744,2679249093
dimwishlist:item=1296429091&perks=1047830412,2420895100,3643424744,2679249093

// Deadpan Delivery PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Overflow, Trench Barrel, Frenzy, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major enemies in end-game content. Decent stats in comparison with its peers. If you're looking for an arc shotgun, Deadpan Delivery is a very decent choice. Start with a barrel perk that boosts handling - Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling both help a little - and Assault Mag improves the low rate of fire. In the first trait column as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size for just picking up an ammo brick and then in the second column signature perk slot, to passively boost damage for end-game use you could use Trench Barrel, Frenzy or Collective Action. You probably won't get much use out of the Nadir Focus Origin Trait, which adds range and accuracy on repeated hits, but it is nice to have anyway. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Nox Perennial V PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Liquid Coils, Ionised Battery, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major enemies and sustained damage against Bosses in end-game content. In case you're wondering, the name translates as "enduring" or "recurring" night - Nox Perennial is the first high-impact fusion rifle and, although the stats aren't top notch, this roll is worth watching for, for Majors and Boss phases for when you're running Tractor Cannon, say. As with all high-impacts, the handling is terrible - Arrowhead Brake adds a moderate amount as well as taking the recoil direction to 95, but Fluted Barrel and Corkscrew Rifling are decent alternatives. You could go in a couple of different directions with the battery perk - Ionic Battery adds two shots don't worry about the reload speed penalty, we can deal with that later, or Accelerated Coils ups the first rate, but Liquid Coils is probably the top choice - again we'll use a trait to reduce the charge time from three business days to something more usable. In the first trait column as the support perk, Envious Assassin can boost the battery to 15 charges with 14 rapid kills with other weapons, while Controlled Burst adds 20% damage while reducing charge time for hitting all your bolts. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=839105230,1483536627,968510818,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=1840239774,1483536627,968510818,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=4090651448,1483536627,968510818,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=839105230,1687452232,968510818,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=1840239774,1687452232,968510818,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2767393525&perks=4090651448,1687452232,968510818,2594592626

// Psi Hermetic V PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, Tactical Mag, Enlightened Action, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi  is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Look for something that helps with recoil direction, handling, stability or a mix as the barrel perk, and add range with Accurized Rounds or the useful gunfeel boosts of Tactical Mag. The traits are a bit PvP focussed - Enlightened Action is the best of the first column support perks, for big boosts to handling and reload speed with just two 3-bullet bursts. For Stasis synergy, Headstone generates a crystal on a crit kill, to use to proc your subclass fragments. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi  is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Look for something that helps with recoil direction, handling, stability or a mix as the barrel perk, and add range with Accurized Rounds or the useful gunfeel boosts of Tactical Mag. While it's a bit more difficult to get Stasis ability kills for the second +50% damage stack to take down Majors, Golden Tricorn is still a great choice for the second column trait as the signature perk. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. // Psi Hermetic V PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Accurized Rounds, Heating Up, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name's a bit confusing - Psi  is the 23rd letter in the Greek Alphabet, and Hermetic can mean something that's occult or mysterious and difficult to understand, relating to the legendary alchemist Hermes Trismegistus, tightly sealed, immune to external influence, or solitary like a hermit, so your guess is as good as anyone's. Anyway, this is a Stasis High Impact pulse rifle with decent stats. Boost range with your barrel and magazine perks - Full Bore or Hammer-Forged Rifling and Accurized Rounds adds up to 3.62m of ADS range. In the first trait column as the support perk, Heating up will straighten up the recoil direction and add stability, while Frenzy in the second column as the signature perk adds 15% damage and maximises handling and reload speed. The Wild Card origin trait is great for PvE - the occasional drop of Telesto-like "Experimental submunitions" on a kill for a bit of free additional damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=358788212&perks=202670084,3142289711,1570042021,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=358788212&perks=3250034553,3142289711,1570042021,4104185692

// Luna Regolith III PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Triple Tap, Clown Cartridge, Field Prep, Explosive Rounds, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Named after the unconsolidated debris that covers the moon's surface, the first thing to say is that, if you already have a decently rolled Aggressive Sniper Rifle in the hope that they get a touch of love in a future balance pass, you can move along as there's nothing to see here. The stats are weak in a currently as at v7.2.0.3 weak subtype, but if you're looking for a more easily obtained weapon, it's still very usable. It's a Vanguard weapon, so there is a huge trait pool - if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. As with all Sniper Rifles, Handling is king - there should be time between shots for the reticule to settle, so you don't need so much stability, making Fluted Barrel the top choice, with Arrowhead Brake, and Corkscrew Rifling as alternates. Tactical Mag gets you four in the mag, which is the same as Appended or Extended, so is the top choice there although Extended Mag + Backup Mag does get you to 5 total. In the first trait column as your support perk, you can make an argument for Triple Tap or Clown Cartridge, both of which can get you to 5 shots without reload with a base mag of 4, or 7/8 shots if the base mag is 5. Alternatively, Field Prep speeds up reloads and boosts reserve ammo. In the second trait column, as your signature perk, Explosive Payload is the best option for additional damage for solo play, or Firing Line works in a fireteam. While it's not a game-changer, the origin trait's Wild Card submunitions can be fun to help damage nearby adds on a kill. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod only with Extended Mag. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Semiotician PvE first-choiceroll
// Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 76 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4UoXFYD3DbunDEKIGDiriX?si=1957400d9e024ed5 with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies, or burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. If you're interested, a Semiotician is someone who studies semiotics - symbols and meanings think Tom Hanks' "Symbologist" character in the Da Vinci Code. While High Impact rocket launchers aren't optimum for damage - doing 10% less damage than adaptives and aggressives - this is still the best Strand RL cvailable as at season 21, with great stats at base. If you're using this against a boss, velocity is more impart and than blast radius, so Quick Launch is your best barrel perk choice, and Impact Casing in the mag adds a little extra damage it all helps!. For your boss damage roll, enhanced Field Prep as the first trait column support park boosts the reload speed but, more importantly, is the equivalent of two reserve mods so you only need one to get to the maximum of 10. Enhanced Explosive Light as the second column signature perk gives you 7 rockets with a 25% damage boost for the low, low costs of just picking up orbs - good for both burst and sustained damage. Whether you find the Head Rush origin trait useful will depend on how often you crouch and get up again - if you do, the additional handling and reload speed is useful, if not game-changing. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2922749929&perks=3525010810,3796465595,2869569095,3194351027

// A Distant Pull PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Overflow, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors and sustained damage against Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. Overflow is laughably good on a special weapon, as a first trait column support park, doubling the magazine size just for picking up an ammo brick, even when stowed. Explosive Payload gives you a 30% passive damage boost, plus flinch, so is easily the best second column trait choice for your signature perk. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1769847435&perks=1840239774,106909392,3643424744,3038247973

// A Distant Pull PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Overflow, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. Overflow is laughably good on a special weapon, as a first trait column support park, doubling the magazine size just for picking up an ammo brick, even when stowed. Collective Action should be easy to proc for a 7 second 20% damage boost as your signature perk, which should be long enough for damage against a stunned Champion or Majors. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Until Its Return PvE first-choice roll
// Rifled Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Threat Detector, Surrounded, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Until Its Return has decent stats in comparison to other kinetic slot rapid-fire shotguns and some reliable trait combinations. You can essentially ignore stability, handling and reload speed with the right traits, so you're left with range choices for the barrel, but Tactical Mag gets you to the maximum of 8 rounds, so there's no point looking at Appended or Extended Mag. In the first trait column as the support perk, Threat Detector at two stacks maxes handling and reload speed, and increases stability to around 80 and Surrounded in the second column as the signature perk boosts damage by 40% +47% for the enhanced version. Alternatively, Trench Barrel boosts damage by 50% for three shots after a melee hit. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Major, Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Until Its Return has decent stats in comparison to other kinetic slot rapid-fire shotguns and some reliable trait combinations. Handling is the best thing to aim for with the barrel perk, but range and stability can be useful too. Tactical Mag gets you to the maximum of 8 rounds, so there's no point looking at Appended or Extended Mag. In the first trait column as the support perk, Overflow is great for doubling the mag size for running over an ammo brick, or Auto-Loading Holster means you can rely on a full magazine every time you pull it out. Surrounded in the second column as the signature perk boosts damage by 40% +47% for the enhanced version. Alternatively, Trench Barrel boosts damage by 50% for three shots after a melee hit. // Thin Precipice PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Flash Counter, Counterattack
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage and Swordmaster's Guard to reduce the time it takes for your heavy attack to charge, although you might want to look at Burst Guard or Heavy Guard to help tank damage. Against a Major that's just about to stomp, bring up your block to us Flash Counter in the first trait column as the support park, to suppress and weaken them for 4s, and then you'll have a couple of seconds with a 50% damage bonus for your heavy spin attack, with Counterattack in the second column as the signature perk. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Supremacy PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Bair and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors in end-game activities. Shapeable. The Supremacy has decent in-band stats by comparison with other kinetic slot rapid-fire snipers. Putting out shots at pace needs some additional control with the barrel perk, but you also need handling if you're swapping between weapons, so Arrowhead Brake or Fluted Barrel are your best choices. Appended Mag gets you to the maximum of 7 in the mag without needing to use Extended Mag. As your first trait column support perk for burst damage, Enhanced Rewind Rounds refills 70% of the hits landed to the magazine from reserves when it's empty, or Lead from Gold is excellent for ammo economy. Bait and Switch as the second slot signature perk adds 35% dame when procced - excellent for burst damage against majors and champions when you don't want to waste power ammo, or if you're running Tractor Cannon and need a damage option. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2884596447&perks=1482024992,1087426260,3418782618,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2884596447&perks=1840239774,1087426260,3418782618,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2884596447&perks=1482024992,1087426260,1556840489,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2884596447&perks=1840239774,1087426260,1556840489,3078487919

// Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Break, Liquid Coils, Rewind Rounds, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Techeun Force however Saint Kabr pronounces it... is reprised in a new, highly desirable perk set. I say set, it's really just one perk in particular. The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. For a damage roll, Liquid Coils is the obvious choice - don't worry, we'll get around the charge time penalty later. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Rewind Rounds means you should be able to keep shooting until the battery is empty - you need a minimum of two shots in the mag to proc it, but then it reloads 2 shots from reserves. Finally, as the signature perk in the second trait slot, the new-for-S21 Controlled Burst drops your charge time by 10% and increases damage by 20% just for hitting all your bolts, making this great for burst and sustained damage. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3591141932&perks=839105230,1687452232,3418782618,2594592626

// Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Break, Liquid Coils, Reconstruction, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Techeun Force however Saint Kabr pronounces it... is reprised in a new, highly desirable perk set. I say set, it's really just one perk in particular. The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. For a damage roll, Liquid Coils is the obvious choice - don't worry, we'll get around the charge time penalty later. In the first trait slot, as the support perk, Reconstruction overfills your magazine to double its capacity, or Envious Assassin can add up to nine shots to the battery with seven rapid kills. Finally, as the signature perk in the second trait slot, the new-for-S21 Controlled Burst drops your charge time by 10% and increases damage by 20% just for hitting all your bolts, making this great for burst and sustained damage. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. // Techeun Force PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Enhanced Battery, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Envious Assassin, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Techeun Force however Saint Kabr pronounces it... is reprised looking good. The stats to start are pretty good, although the recoil direction needs some attention, so Arrowhead Brake will take that to a controllable 90. Enhanced Battery then takes you to the maximum battery size. If you've not already got an arc-based Golden Tricorn fusion rifle, then look for Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction or Envious Assassin in the first trait slot as your support perk, to help with your uptime, and then Golden Tricorn is great for a reliable 15% refreshable damage bump up that goes up to a chunky 50% with an arc ability kill. If you're a grenade-heavy player, the Explosive Pact origin trait adds in some nice gunfeel boosts too. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Apex Predator PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Reconstruction, Demolitionist, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against majors and sustained damage against bosses in end-game activities. Shapeable. Apex Predator has gone from the insta-shard class when it dropped, to pretty much the best rocket launcher option for putting out damage. Even though the stats are only middling, and you can't get to 10 shots - the maximum is 9, with two reserve mods, it's already in the highest subfamily for damage along with Aggressives, and is the best craftable rocket launcher in the game, as at S21. For an unguided rocket, Velocity is usually the play for the barrel perk - Hard Launch and Quick Launch are the two best options, depending on whether you want better Velocity or a combination of Velocity and Handling. Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage in the magazine perk slot. In the first trait column as the support perk, you can have a choice of Reconstruction to passively overfill the barrel with 2 shots, or Demolitionist for the instant reload when throwing a grenade and the extra damage from the grenade as well. Enhanced Explosive Light lets you shoot seven rockets with a 25% damage boost, just for picking up orbs. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1851777734&perks=981914802,3796465595,3523296417,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=1851777734&perks=981914802,3796465595,1523832109,3194351027

// Apex Predator PvE first-choice roll
// Confined Launch, Impact Casing, Tracking Module, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 69 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3ZIEMYfNzOu5TyLlLhU7hH?si=90ffff909a2e40f2 with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects - @ImpetusAlways is on holiday. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against majors and bosses with short damage windows in end-game activities. Shapeable. Apex Predator has gone from the insta-shard class when it dropped, to pretty much the best rocket launcher option for putting out damage. Even though the stats are only middling, and you can't get to 10 shots - the maximum is 9, with two reserve mods, it's already in the highest subfamily for damage along with Aggressives, and is the best craftable rocket launcher in the game, as at S21. For a guided rocket, you want to velocity as low as possible, to give the shot plenty of time for course correction if your target jinks, and Confined Launch is the barrel to do that. Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage in the magazine perk slot. In the first trait column Tracking Module is very useful for hitting more mobile majors and bosses, while in the second slot as the signature perk, Enhanced Explosive Light lets you shoot seven rockets with a 25% damage boost, just for picking up orbs. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1851777734&perks=1844523823,3796465595,3977735242,3194351027

// Compass Rose PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Barrel Shroud, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Lead From Gold, Grave Robber, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. First thing to say, if you already have a rapid hit or lightweight Trench Barrel shotgun then just shard this. If you haven't, then Compass Rose can be your stopgap until you do. The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but Handling is usually the play with shotguns anyway, so Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud improve that, as well as other useful gunfeel stats, and Assault Mag increases your rate of fire, and hence DPS, or Tactical Mag takes the mag size to six to let you get two full bursts of three shots off without reloading, and then helps with reload speed. Grave Robber can be useful, if you're near a crowd of minors to keep Trench Barrel procced, but if you're doing damage against a single target it's not much use, so Lead From Gold is more reliably useful. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=233896077&perks=4090651448,791862061,1556840489,2360754333

// Compass Rose PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Barrel Shroud, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Lead From Gold, Grave Robber, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. First thing to say, if you already have a rapid hit or lightweight Incandescent shotgun then just shard this. If you haven't, then Compass Rose can be your stopgap until you do. The stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but Handling is usually the play with shotguns anyway, so Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud improve that, as well as other useful gunfeel stats, and Assault Mag increases your rate of fire, and hence DPS, or Tactical Mag takes the mag size to six and helps with reload speed. Grave Robber can be useful for reloads, as you'll likely be in CQC, or Lead From Gold is top-tier to help with your ammo economy. Incandescent is great for crowd control, particularly if you're on a solar subclass and can use your fragments to enhance the 3.0 verbs. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Crowning Duologue PvE first-choice roll
// Confined Launch, Impact Casing, Alloy Casing, Field Prep Envious Assassin, Cluster Bombs
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 72 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5vRI9hBynq3jq712XCu7oc?si=c87cbb8036254e4a with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ???  ???: First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. It's difficult to know what role Precision rocket launchers are suppose to fill as at season 21. they do have the intrinsic tracking, but to 21% less damage than the adaptive and aggressive subfamilies, and can't ever compete with the blast radius of high-impacts for add clear. If you are going to use it, play into the tracking, and reduce the velocity so if an enemy jinks, it has as much time as possible to adjust with Confined Launch. Impact Casing adds some extra impact damage in the mag perk slot, or Alloy Casing provides faster reloads. Field Prep helps massively with ammo reserves - without it it you'll need three ammo reserve chest mods to get to 10 rockets, but with it you'll only need one. In the second trait column Envious Assassin can get you an extra shot in the mag with just one kill from another weapon, or if you can get to 11 rapid kills, you can load three, or you can use the small blast radius as a benefit to concentrate Cluster Bombs on your target for extra damage. The Dream Works origin trait is useful in a fireteam to get the occasional overflowed magazine in a firefight too. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3256453690&perks=1844523823,3796465595,2869569095,968510818
dimwishlist:item=3256453690&perks=1844523823,2985827016,2869569095,968510818
dimwishlist:item=3256453690&perks=1844523823,3796465595,2869569095,1275731761

// Loaded Question PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Overflow doubles your magazine size just for running over a special ammo brick, or 7-8 rapid kills with another weapon overfills the magazine by up to 10 shots with Envious Assassin. Every shot in your overfilled mag, beyond it's normal limit, can be used with Controlled Burst - hit all the bolts to get +20% to damage and 10% reduced charge time to burst down Majors and maybe for the occasional boss DPS phase. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game activities. Loaded Question is back, and has some interesting new combinations. Being a high-impact fusion rifle, there are only five bolts, so stability is slightly less of an issue - Fluted Barrel adds useful handling, and Hammer-Forged Rifling or Smallbore add Range as the barrel perk. There are traits which bypass reload time and work best with as large a magazine as possible, so Ionized or Enhanced Battery are the top battery choices. // BrayTech Osprey PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Hard Launch, Impact Casing, Field Prep, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey has the worst stats in its subfamily. But there might be an interesting roll for burst damage worth looking at anyway. Increase the velocity stat with the barrel and masterwork - Quick Launch and Hard Launch are the best options, and Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage. In the first trait column as the support perk, for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against a Boss, Field Prep for the extra reserves, which means you only have to run two reserves mods for the maximum number of rockets, and have the reload speed boost when crouched. In the second trait slot as the signature perk, Bipod could be very interesting - two in the mag, even with the loss of damage being offset by less need to reload. Maybe one to keep, just in case. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3667553455&perks=3525010810,3796465595,2869569095,1439600632

// BrayTech Osprey PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Hard Launch, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey has the worst stats in its subfamily. But there might be an interesting roll for burst damage worth looking at anyway. Increase the velocity stat with the barrel and masterwork - Quick Launch and Hard Launch are the best options, and Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage. In the first trait column as the support perk, for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against a Boss, six rapid kills with another another weapon with Envious Assassin can get you five rockets in the mag just don't ask how that works.... In the second trait slot as the signature perk, Bipod could be very interesting - at base, two or more in the mag, even with the loss of damage being offset by less need to reload, could still make for higher DPS than standard launchers. Maybe one to keep, just in case Bipod gets a little buff. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// BrayTech Osprey Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Hard Launch, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 68 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7e93LMhFDUbZZX5SKYzXf0?si=cec8c26785114ffb with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear in end-game activities. High-Impact Rocket Launchers are meant for add-clear - they have the highest blast radius stat of the subfamilies and do middling damage - 10% less than Adaptives or Aggressives. And saying that, BrayTech Osprey Adept has the worst stats in its subfamily. But there might be an interesting roll for burst damage worth looking at anyway. Increase the velocity stat with the barrel and masterwork - Quick Launch and Hard Launch are the best options, and Impact Casing adds 2.2% multiplicative damage. In the first trait column as the support perk, for burst damage against Majors or sustained damage against a Boss, six rapid kills with another another weapon with Envious Assassin can get you five rockets in the mag just don't ask how that works.... In the second trait slot as the signature perk, Bipod could be very interesting - at base, two or more in the mag, even with the loss of damage being offset by less need to reload, could still make for higher DPS than standard launchers. Maybe one to keep, just in case Bipod gets a little buff. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1064132738&perks=3525010810,3796465595,968510818,1439600632
dimwishlist:item=1064132738&perks=981914802,3796465595,968510818,1439600632

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Arrowhead Brake in the barrel takes it to a manageable 84. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,106909392,1354429876,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3230963543,1354429876,3038247973

// Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Assault Mag, Reconstruction, Fourth Time's the Charm, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Assault Mag increases RPM to 70 to increase your damage output. As your first trait column support perk, Reconstruction or Fourth Time's The Charm both work to extend the magazine during a damage window and, for your second column signature perk, take your choice of Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon or Focused Fury to boost damage output with. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills, which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Void subclass synergy in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still be effective to control beefier minors, and majors. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Tactical Mag boosts your mag size, stability and reload speed, so is a bit of a no-brainer for the magazine perk. It's unusual to be able to roll two Void perks, so the opportunity to roll Repulsor Brace in the first trait column as your support perk, for damage reduction void overshields, and Destabilizing Rounds as your signature perk in the second to spread volatility on a kill is difficult to pass up. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Paracausal Affinity

First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Acasia's Dejection Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk can both take advantage of the higher damage stacks of Target Lock as your second column signature perk, turning this into a legendary solar Coldheart. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Light subclass synergy for Majors in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against Majors, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Paracausal Affinity's 20% damage boost after a kill from any Light damage source as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Harsh Language PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Field Prep, Threat Detector, Stats for All, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper although the range of stats is pretty compressed - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. In the first trait column Envious Assassin can give you up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon, but Field Prep, Threat Detector or Stats for All are all worth considering as a support perk. Void subclasses provide a great toolkit to trigger the second stack of Golden Tricorn for 50% bonus damage, in the second trait column for your signature perk. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Hand in Hand PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Slideshot, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for sustained damage to Bosses and Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently as at v7.0.0.6 in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Building towards One-Two Punch as your signature perk, Full Choke aids pellet spread, as you'll need to hit your target with all of them. Then Tactical Mag adds an extra extra shot and a bonuses to reload speed and stability which admittedly, you'll not need so much. As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full for One-Two Punch in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Hand in Hand PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Slideshot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. The reprised Hand in Hand is the only non-endgame arc aggressive shotgun currently as at v7.0.0.6 in game but, as usual for a world drop, the stats are on the low side - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. Handling is the standard play for shotguns, so Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling are your best choices. Assault Mag brings your RPM up to 60 and also boosts stability - maybe not so essential with a slower firing shottie, but still nice. As your support perk in the first trait column, Slideshot is normally regarded as a PvP-flavoured perk but bypasses the reload to keep the magazine full, and you can take advantage of the arc toolkit to proc the second stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column to boost damage by 50%, as well as proccing useful arc verbs, like Blinding with Spark of Beacons. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=664109750&perks=1300023272,791862061,3161816588,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=664109750&perks=4090651448,791862061,3161816588,2610012052

// Nasreddin PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for damage to Bosses in end-game content. First thing to say about the reprised Nasreddin named for a legendary trickster figure in Muslin folklore is that if you already have a decent arc sword, you can give this a miss, as there's nothing that really makes it stand out except, maybe, for a slightly higher base Impact stat, and the new Devrim Kay VIII Foundry origin trait which should make the heavy attack rechage rate a little faster, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. For newer Guardians, the usual recommendations of Jagged Edge as the blade perk for additinal damage, Swordmaster's Guard for the guard perk to get the heavy attack up as fast as possible. Then Relentless Strikes as your support perk in the first trait column, which works well to return ammo against all enemies, and either Whirlwind Blade or Surrounded, to boost damage, for your signature perk in the second. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Marsilion-C PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control and, even with 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will still provide some extra impact damage as your mag perk. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon skills so you can take full advantage of the Enhanced Explosive Light's extra stack of damage over the standard version and have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Marsilion-C PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Envious Assassin, Field Prep, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. ??? ???: First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. If you looking for a fun add-clear weapon for bulkier minors, with an eye towards Incandescent as your signature perk in the second trait slot, then maximise your Blast Radius with your barrel and mag perks, and masterwork - Volatile Launch or Confined Launch with High-Explosive Ordnance. Envious Assassin overflows the magazine from primary and special weapon kills, or Field Prep adds bonus reserves and reload speed as you options for your support park in the first trait column. Both add utility to Incandescent, and you can add Ember of Ashes for more scorch stacks and faster ignitions. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=1844523823,1380253176,968510818,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=1478423395,1380253176,2869569095,4293542123

// Royal Executioner PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option to control the bolts, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is the stand out support perk in the first trait column - overflow the magazine with primary and power weapon kills, and this is the only non-Raid fusion rifle that you can do that with. Every overflowed shot will then do 25% bonus damage with Reservoir Burst as your second trait column, signature perk, as well as making enemies explode, making this great for both add-clearing groups of minors and burst damage against majors. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,968510818,4293542123

// Caretaker PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Flash Counter, Surrounded, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 except DSC's Bequest, and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support park in the first trait column, Relentless Strikes don't require a kill to return ammo, so is best for chunkier adds and Majors, although Flash Counter's weaken effect is also worth considering. Majors are usually accompanied by minors, so Surrounded especially when enhanced or One for All as signature perks in the second trait column can both work well when you need to do damage up close. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,2590710093,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,4293542123

First-choice PvE roll for Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 except DSC's Bequest. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support park in the first trait column, Relentless Strikes don't require a kill to return ammo, so is best for chunkier adds and Majors, although Flash Counter's weaken effect is also worth considering. Majors are usually accompanied by Minor adds, so Surrounded especially when enhanced or One for All as signature perks in the second trait column both work well.
