// Tripwire Canary PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. Explosive Head not only adds bonus damage passively, but also disrupts overload Champions in fewer hits, when the mod is around. MW: Draw Time or Accuracy, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3849444474&perks=2801223209,3429800428,201365942,3365897133

// Tripwire Canary PvE backup roll
// Elastic String, Flexible String, Polymer String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Helical Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, aim to get the draw time as low as you can with your bowstring, and then recover lost accuracy with your arrow. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. Explosive Head not only adds bonus damage passively, but also disrupts overload Champions in fewer hits, when the mod is around. MW: Draw Time or Accuracy, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-champion, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Path of Least Resistance PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Particle Repeater, Triple Tap, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or Omolon Fluid Dynamics' extra stability and reload speed is always welcome. An arc legendary trace rifle to complete the energy set. Stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but there are a few interesting rolls, and at least now you can collect them all! Pump up stability as high as it will go to keep your shots on target. The legendary Coldheart-lite roll - Focused Fury kicks in 20% bonus damage after half of the base battery shots are crits, and if you keep hitting crits, Triple Tap will extend the battery. Keep it in your back pocket for bosses with big crit spots or when someone is using Divinity. MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Pair that with the newly buffed Surrounded for a ridiculous 40% 47% for the Enhanced version bonus to projectile damage for just for being near three enemies. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2978226043&perks=580685494,1087426260,3643424744,3708227201

// Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Unstoppable Force
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Unstoppable Force then gives a 30% damage bonus to projectiles for blocking with your shield, letting you tank damage and take on beefier adds and Majors. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. For damage against a single target, you want your magazine as large as it will go, so look for Extended or Appended. Then extend the magazine with Fourth Time's the Charm, or improve your ammo reserves and reload with Field Prep in the first trait column to give Target Lock's 40& bonus to damage as much uptime as possible. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,2420895100,2869569095,365154968
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,1087426260,2869569095,365154968
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,2420895100,1354429876,365154968
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,1087426260,1354429876,365154968

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable  boss-killing replacement for Reed's Regret, and a aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser. Being a stasis LFR, it's easy to get a Font of Might 25% boost to your damage if you have a Warlock putting down a Well and willing to use the Supreme Wellmaker mod, and you're using the Elemental Shards and Elemental Time Dilation mods. You'll need to keep your shots on a boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For major or boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger. Frenzy is an easily procced 15% damage boost just for being in combat, or Vorpal Weapon is an uncomplicated 10% boost against Majors and Bosses. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,4104185692

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Headstone, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable stasis LFR replacement for Reed's Regret, and an aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser.  You'll need to keep your shots on a major or boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For major or boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger. For stasis subclass synergy, Fire and Forget can roll or be crafted with two stasis perks - use Headstone and Chill Clip for stasis crystals and slow stacks to work your Aspects and Fragments on. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Glacioclasm PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Subsistence, Slideshot, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE backup roll for Void subclass in endgame content. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. There are no real holes in the stats, but Fluted Barrel or Smallbore provide nice boosts in the barrel. In the battery, Enhanced Battery gets you more shots, Particle Repeater helps keep the burst tight, or if you're a little impatient, Accelerated Coils reduces charge time. For Void subclasses, the second stack of Golden Tricorn should be easy to proc with the melee and grenade toolkit, and Subsistence or Slideshot keeps you putting out damage. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
Arrowhead Brake. Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Ambitious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for chunkier Minors with a Solar subclass in endgame content. Option of Suros Synergy or the Dawning Surprise origin trait which can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Balanced stats, so you can use Arrowhead Brake to get straight recoil, or Fluted Barrel for extra Handling and Stability. In the mag slot, we'll be wanting to take full advantage of Ambitious Assassin's 10% bonus mag size per rapid kill after reloading with a size-boosting option. Then use the Target Lock second-column trait to get up to a passive 40% damage boost against a single target just for shooting at it - ideal for Major or Boss damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Mechabre PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Appended Mag, Clown Cartridge, Vorpal Weapon, High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look no further than Fluted Barrel to boost Handling and Stability. It's difficult to get to five in the mag to make Triple Tap proc twice, so go for Appended Mag instead to add an extra round. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge boosts magazine size by a shot or two on reload, and in the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles or High-Impact Reserves will add up to 25% bonus damage once you get past the second bullet. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1280894514&perks=1840239774,1087426260,2284787283,2213355989

// Commemoration PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 48 with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. The Bray Inheritance trait is really useful for PvE, returning from 0.46% to 2% ability energy from hits the amount depends on the weapon archetype. Good stats and a stellar PvE perk pool make this an LMG worth chasing. You can choose to sort the recoil with Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel, or improve stability with Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. Most mag choices could have a role - boost your magazine size with Tactical, Appended or Extended Mag. Killing Tally is the easiest to proc damage boosting perk if you're killing adds - 3 kills equals 30% bonus damage until you stow or reload, which you won't have to do much with Subsistence refreshing your magazine, so you could keep firing until you're empty. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag, or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// The Militia's Birthright PvE first-choice roll
// Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Slideways, Ambitious Assassin, Frenzy, One For All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors and stunned Champions in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good Spike Grenade roll on an Ignition Code or Pardon Our Dust. Handling and Velocity are what you need in your barrel, and Quick Launch delivers both. Spike Grenades adds damage for direct hits, and there's a case for both Slideways for reloading and a Handling boost, or Ambitious Assassin to improve damage output in your first trait column, and Frenzy or One For All in the second. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Mindbender's Ambition PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Puglist, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE first-choice roll for burst damage against Majors and stunned Champions in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good solar shotgun that does the same job. There's a few barrel perk options - Corkscrew Rifling or Barrel Shroud for more handling, or Smallbore for a bit more range. In the mag, Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are two solid choices. Then, in the trait columns Puglist is hard to ignore for melee builds and pairs with Swashbuckler for your bonus damage against beefier enemies. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a good solar shotgun that does the same job. // Doom of Chelchis PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Explosive Payload, Vorpal Weapon, Frenzy, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! With a Precision Frame, you won't need to worry too much about recoil direction, and you already have tonnes of range, so focus on Stability and Handling, with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to help further with stability and reload speed. It's rare to be able to roll two damage perks so if you're looking for something that you can use against Minor adds, the occasional Major or Champion, then Explosive Payload or Vorpal Weapon, in combination with Frenzy or Focused Fury should give you pretty much permanent additional damage uptime.  Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Explosive Payload, One For All, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with either Tactical Mag or Appended Mag plus a Backup Mag mod, to help with the origin trait boost. For end-game content with a fireteam, Explosive Payload adds flinch and damage and is useful to disrupt Overload Champions with a matching mod, and One For All or Focused Fury are your reliable damage boost sources. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Zaouli's Bane PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Ensemble, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Solar subclasses in general content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Good in-slot stats and a great perk pool will give probably give you crafting headaches to shape and level all the rolls you might want! Use the barrel to round out your preferred Range/ Stability/ Handling stat, and then you want as many bullets in the mag as possible with Extended Mag using a trait to help with the reload penalty, to help with the origin trait boost. Then, to synergise with Solar subclasses, you can craft a mini-Sunshot by taking Ensemble for the faster reload and handling in a fireteam, together with Incandescent for your scorch and ignite explosion chaining. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Qullim's Terminus PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats For All, Heating Up, Unrelenting, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Stasis builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. The only High-Impact Stasis LMG available as at v6.2.0.6, but comparing to other HIs, the stats are a mixed bunch. It's slow-firing, so you should be able to control the recoil with extra stability from the barrel choice. Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell are both good choices in the mag slot. Treat this as a heavy Scout Rifle for dealing with beefier adds and choose your traits accordingly - Stats For All or Heating Up add significant gunfeel boosts, or Unrelenting helps with health regeneration. For Stasis subclasses, Headstone provides a starting point for boosting abilities, crowd control or gaining damage reduction. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag with Enhanced RB you only need Enhanced Battery. You can get around the reload penalty from Ionised Battery when crouching with Field Prep and have more ammo in reserve to use in combination with Reservoir Burst. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Enhanced Battery, Unrelenting, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag with Enhanced RB you only need Enhanced Battery. You should be getting plenty of kills with Reservoir Burst, so you can use Unrelenting to recover your health while in combat. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. // Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Cornered, Field Prep, Unrelenting, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time with Cornered, add ammo reserves and faster reloads with Field Prep, or trigger health regeneration on kills with Unrelenting in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Reservoir Burst procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, giving you a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Midha's Reckoning PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Cornered, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for Arc 3.0 builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time for burst damage against Majors with Cornered, in the first trait column. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to 13 shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. Golden Tricorn x2 boosts damage by 50% for 10s, to melt Majors and the occasional Boss maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=3250034553,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1482024992,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=1840239774,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=4090651448,689005463,1799762209,2610012052
dimwishlist:item=3969066556&perks=839105230,689005463,1799762209,2610012052

// Midha's Reckoning Harrowed PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Ionised Battery, Field Prep, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Origin Perk is aimed at playing with a fireteam - the larger, the better your magazine size after reload will be. Decent in-slot stats compared to Exile's Curse or Wizened Rebuke. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag. You can get around the reload penalty from Ionised Battery when crouching with Field Prep and have more ammo in reserve to use in combination with Reservoir Burst. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Increasing the battery size with Ionised Battery and Reservoir Burst pushes you to the maximum of 8 in the mag. You should be getting plenty of kills with Reservoir Burst, so you can use Unrelenting to recover your health while in combat. With a battery size of eight, you'll get up to five overflowed shots with the origin trait if you're in a Raid near a full fireteam, or three reloading in a normal fireteam of three. RB procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, with a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. Generally, with fewer bolts being fired from a High-Impact frame, you don't have to worry so much about stability, so can either push the range or improve handling with your barrel. Any Battery with Backup Mag pushes you up to eight shots in the battery, so why not take advantage of a shorter charge time from Accelerated Coils? Further build into the faster charge time with Cornered, add ammo reserves and faster reloads with Field Prep, or trigger health regeneration on kills with Unrelenting in the first trait column. Reservoir Burst procs on any overflowed charges from the origin trait, giving you a 25% damage bonus and those lovely explosions on kills maybe with Arc 3.0 Spark of Beacons for a bit of blinding too on them all. // Tarnished Mettle PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles, so that's not very useful for a Scout Rifle. Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction, and either Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell help with both stability and Reload Speed. For endgame, both Fourth Time's The Charm and Rapid Hit help keep the bullets coming, and Explosive Payload helps with damage, flinch and disrupting Overload Champions when the mods around. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// No Reprieve PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Outlaw, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 31. PvE first-choice roll for general content. The Origin Perk works well in CQC, and in particular for melee-heavy playstyles. High-ish stats make this fairly competitive in slot if you don't look too closely at Heritage, anyway. You can never go wrong with a bit more range from your barrel, and faster fire rate, or an extra round in the mag and better reload speed. For endgame content, Outlaw keeps the bullets coming, and Surrounded provides a huge boost to CQC damage, complimenting the origin perk, and will help with damage against champions when the mod is in town. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Pardon Our Dust PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Blinding Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Danger Zone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 26. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Another opportunity to get a kinetic Blinding Grenade Launcher, if you haven't already - an essential tool in any end-game toolbox. You'll be swapping back and forth, so go for a handling barrel. Obviously Blinding Grenades in the mag, and then Auto-Loading Holster to reload while you're mopping up your blinded enemies with your Energy weapon. There's not that much in the second column of traits, but Danger Zone give you additional damage options when you're in CQC. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Wastelander M5 PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Pugilist, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 30. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. The first Tex Mechanica legendary weapon - a lightweight, so it boosts mobility for movement speed. To clear majors, use Full Choke to constrain the pellet spread a little, Tactical Mag for an extra bullet in the magazine or Assault Mag if you miss a pellet. Then, Pugilist and the Hot Swap origin perk help boost handling, and One-Two Punch adds a huge damage boost against majors and bosses. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

This was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and the S18 reissued version new lets you build into scorch and ignite. Subsistence keeps your battery topped up, and then Incandescent makes this a great choice for Solar 3.0 builds. // Judgment PvE first-choice roll
// Fastdraw HCS, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, 
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Very stiff competition in-slot from Fatebringer, Eyasluna and DFA, but there are a few trait combinations that help claim a spot in your Vault. Look to boost Handling and Stability with sight and mag, to help gunfeel or maybe add a bullet or two. For end-game content, Ensemble helps speed reloads and Timed Payload adds damage, helps with Overload stuns and can proc Explosive Wellmaker. Drops from the first Phalanx Echo encounter if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// QuickDot SAS, Control SAS, Shortspec SAS, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Threat Detector, Surplus, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Sidearms are a... brave choice of Primary for endgame content. Handling and Stability could both do with some help from sight and mag, or the Combat Effect mags are always useful. This does drop with the combination of Armor-Piercing Rounds and Disruption Break, which makes it a strong choice for Barrier Champions, when the corresponding mod is in play. Drops from the second Hexahedron Room encounter if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Major Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content and anti-Champion mods. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, for void burn activities. The Recoil Direction needs some love, so Arrowhead Brake is your top choice, and Tactical Mag gives an extra shot, stability and reload speed. For endgame and anti-Champion use particularly Overloads, Rapid Hit and Explosive Payload are your top choices. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod or a Full Auto Retrofit, to save your trigger finger. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Slideshot, Field Prep, Lead From Gold, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for general content. Still worth looking at, even without an origin perk, with the update 4.1.5 buff to pellet shotguns. For boss damage, Full Choke keeps pellets together. Assault Mag helps with a follow-up shot if you miss a pellet, or Tactical Mag, Appended or Extended Mag all give the same +1 to mag size. Slideshot gets you reloads on the fly, Field Prep helps with both inventory or reloads, or Lead From Gold saves you running a finder/scavenger perk. Surrounded and the Spec mod gives a 40% CQC damage boost in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Surrounded Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Black Powder, Auto-Loading Holster, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Middle of the road for raw damage, but the largest blast radius of any subtype. Maximise the blast radius with barrel and mag, and then Field Prep helps with reloads and inventory or Auto-Loading Holster lets you put the launcher away to focus on other enemies. Chain Reaction can help clear beefier adds in a crowd with minors. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Nation of Beasts PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Outlaw, Ambitious Assassin, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Round out the stats with barrel and mag. Both Ambitious Assassin and Outlaw have their place in the first trait column, and then Explosive Rounds adds damage and flinch, and helps with anti-Champion mods. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag or damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-endgame, pve-minor, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// Tyranny of Heaven PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. Although suffering by comparison with the Precision bow subtype, if you've got a good roll, it's maybe worth hanging onto in case they ever get a bit of love. Your aim is to maximise damage output by getting as many arrows into opponents as possible, so get the Reload and Draw Speed down as far as possible with your bowstring and arrow. Archer's Tempo helps further speed up your RPM and Explosive Head boosts damage, adds flinch and helps with anti-champion mods. Recommended MW: Reload or Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-champion, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2721249463&perks=2801223209,16392701,201365942,3365897133

// Apex Predator PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Ambitious Assassin, Kill CLip
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 23. PvE first choice roll for endgame content. The highest damage subtype. Improve the Velocity with the barrel, and damage with Impact Casing. Then, if you can get a kill before you need burst damage against a major or champion, you can reload for two shots with +33% damage with the Ambitious Assassin and Kill Clip combination. Recommended MW: Reload, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-endgame, pve-god, pve-major, pve-champion, controller, mkb

// taken from https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep106-pale-heart-weapons.txt

@title:Episode 106 - Pale Heart weapons
@description:Pale Heart DLC weapons with the Dealer's Choice origin trait

// No Hesitation First-choice PvE
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Physic, Circle of Life
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content, particularly with solar/prismatic fragments that boost healing. Shapeable. A new Support frame auto-rifle subtype that builds healing charges on enemy hits there's a semi-circle below the reticule that fills up which you can then hip fire at allies to heal them. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. This also grants both Guardians a +10% "Support Frame boost" to damage for 5s, which stacks with every other damage buff source. No Hesitation is probably the strongest solar primary currently in the game, if you're in a fireteam. It's a bit weird to fire as it's not hitscan - but if you can get used to Osteo Striga's tracking shots, you'll do fine. First off, controller players might benefit from a bit of extra stability from the barrel and mag perks. The first and second trait column perks can double down on the frame intrinsic perks through Physic which grants x1 Restoration x2 when enhanced for 5s to both you and allies when procced, and Circle of Life which boosts damage on healing by an additional +25% for 10s +37.5% total for the first 5s with the Support Frame Boost for both you and the healed Guardian. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=1482024992,106909392,2980589453,2298656195
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=1392496348,106909392,2980589453,2298656195
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=4090651448,106909392,2980589453,2298656195

dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=1392496348,3230963543,2980589453,2298656195

// No Hesitation First-choice PvE
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Physic, Attrition Orbs, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content, particularly with solar/prismatic fragments that boost healing. Shapeable. A new Support frame auto-rifle subtype that builds healing charges on enemy hits there's a semi-circle below the reticule that fills up which you can then hip fire at allies to heal them. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. This also grants both Guardians a +10% "Support Frame boost" to damage for 5s, which stacks with every other damage buff source. No Hesitation is probably the strongest solar primary currently in the game, if you're in a fireteam. It's a bit weird to fire as it's not hitscan - but if you can get used to Osteo Striga's tracking shots, you'll do fine. First off, controller players might benefit from a bit of extra stability from the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column Physic grants x1 Restoration x2 when enhanced for 5s to both you and allies while, in the second, either Attrition Orbs can proc on healing shots, which makes orbs easier to pick up in endgame when they're next to an ally, or Surrounded massively boosts damage when procced with the frame intrinsic by +54%, or 61% with enhanced Surrounded. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// No Hesitation First-choice PvE
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Physic, Incandescent, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content, particularly with complementary solar/prismatic fragments. Shapeable. A new Support frame auto-rifle subtype that builds healing charges on enemy hits there's a semi-circle below the reticule that fills up which you can then hip fire at allies to heal them. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. This also grants both Guardians a +10% "Support Frame boost" to damage for 5s, which stacks with every other damage buff source. No Hesitation is probably the strongest solar primary currently in the game, if you're in a fireteam. It's a bit weird to fire as it's not hitscan - but if you can get used to Osteo Striga's tracking shots, you'll do fine. First off, controller players might benefit from a bit of extra stability from the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column Physic grants x1 Restoration x2 when enhanced for 5s to both you and allies while, in the second, Incandescent is great for red bar add crowd control or Frenzy is great for all-round utility, boosting damage by +26.5% when procced with the frame intrinsic, along with maxxed-out handling and reload. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// No Hesitation First-choice PvE
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Demolitionist, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content. Shapeable. A new Support frame auto-rifle subtype that builds healing charges on enemy hits there's a semi-circle below the reticule that fills up which you can then hip fire at allies to heal them. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. This also grants both Guardians a +10% "Support Frame boost" to damage for 5s, which stacks with every other damage buff source. No Hesitation is probably the strongest solar primary currently in the game, if you're in a fireteam. It's a bit weird to fire as it's not hitscan - but if you can get used to Osteo Striga's tracking shots, you'll do fine. First off, controller players might benefit from a bit of extra stability from the barrel and mag perks. Demolitionist is great in the first trait column, but for grenade energy and instant reloads on a grenade throw, while Desperate Measures is very easy to proc with intrinsic for +10, +20 or +30% damage +21, +32 or +43% when the frame intrinsic is also procced. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! // Bold Endings First-choice PvE
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Rapid Hit, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. There aren't many comparators for Bold Endings - the good news is that the base stats are great, but the bad news is that they're still not very good, with stability, handling and reload speed all low so, although it's hard-hitting, it feels a bit clunky. Use the barrel and magazine perks to fill in the gaps. To help further, you can quickly get to the maximum stacks of Rapid Hit as the first trait perk, and you have ways of getting to three stacks of Desperate Measures using Transcendent melee and grenade for up to +30% damage. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Bold Endings First-choice PvE
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Headstone, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly when using Stasis fragments. Shapeable. There aren't many comparators for Bold Endings - the good news is that the base stats are great, but the bad news is that they're still not very good, with stability, handling and reload speed all low so, although it's hard-hitting, it feels a bit clunky. Use the barrel and magazine perks to fill in the gaps. If you're using Stasis-friendly subclass fragments to support your build, you should be able to create plenty of crystals with Headstone in the first trait column and generate shards that you can use to proc Collective Action's +20% damage boost. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Bold Endings First-choice PvE
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Headstone, Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly when using Stasis fragments. Shapeable. There aren't many comparators for Bold Endings - the good news is that the base stats are great, but the bad news is that they're still not very good, with stability, handling and reload speed all low so, although it's hard-hitting, it feels a bit clunky. Use the barrel and magazine perks to fill in the gaps. This roll is a speculative one, if you drop one, If you're using Stasis-friendly subclass fragments to support your build, you should be able to create plenty of crystals with Headstone in the first trait column to work with to proc fragments, and Demolitionist in the second column is always handy on a primary weapon to keep your grenade ability charged. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=496728945&perks=1840239774,106909392,124408337,3523296417

dimwishlist:item=496728945&perks=1840239774,3230963543,124408337,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=496728945&perks=4090651448,3230963543,124408337,3523296417

// Embraced Identity First-choice PvE
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against major and bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. If you already have a good backup DPS sniper then you can safely pass on Embraced Identity. Decent base stats so, as ever, handling is the stat to boost with the barrel perk. Tactical Mag plus a Backup Mag mod gets you to 6 shots, or Appended Mag + Backup Mag gets you to 7. In the first trait column, Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction are both excellent. In the second column, Precision Instrument or High Ground both boost damage via different proc mechanisms, depending on whether you have a big crit spot to aim for, or can get your feet at least one metre higher than the feet of what you're shooting at so, weirdly, you can have it procced and still be shooting up at a taller enemy's head. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Pro Memoria First-choice PvE
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Extended mag, Appended Mag, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Target Lock, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35 with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained DPS against Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the barrel perk to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, for sustained boss damage, you'll want a perk that increases mag size or possibly helps a little more with recoil control. For sustained damage, in the first trait perk column, choose between Reconstruction for an effortless overflowed mag or Envious Assassin for a potentially bigger overflowed mag that needs add kills. In the second column, Target Lock or Bait and Switch although the swap speed isn't great make the most of your bullets in a sustained boss DPS phase. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have who doesn't love more super energy? - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Episode 103 - BRAVE weapons part 2 missing Shiny rolls
@description:Second six Season 23 BRAVE arsenal weapons with the Indomitability origin trait

// Midnight Coup Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Explosive Payload, Kinetic Tremors, One for All, Frenzy, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. It's not often you get access to two damage boost traits that don't need a weapon kill to proc, so take advantage of Explosive Payload in the first column, and then Kinetic Tremors which is strong on hand cannons against majors and minors, One for All, Frenzy or Desperate Measures to help tear through adds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Blast Furnace Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Kinetic Tremors, Frenzy, One For All, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent although you don't get any of the stat bonuses. The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. It's not often you get the option of two damage traits - Kinetic Tremors takes 11 hits to proc - one less when enhanced - for AoE damage in the first column. In the second, you can't really go wrong with Frenzy, One For All or Desperate Measures for a more direct passive damage boost, that doesn't need a weapon kill. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=839105230,3230963543,3891536761,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1840239774,106909392,3891536761,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=839105230,106909392,3891536761,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,2109543898
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=839105230,3230963543,3891536761,2109543898
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1840239774,106909392,3891536761,2109543898
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=839105230,106909392,3891536761,2109543898

// Luna's Howl Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Luna's Howl was changed from a Precision to an Adaptive back in the day, so the stats do look weird in comparison to its peers - it's stable and easy to use, but might feel strange if you're used to traditional 140 HCs. Take a barrel perk that gives you a little bit of everything to round things out - Corkscrew, Smallbore or Fluted. For the mag perk, you want the reload as snappy as possible - Flared Magwell has the biggest boost, with Light Mag a close second. There's really only one trait perk combination to search for - Heal Clip hence the need for reload speed and Incandescent. Great anyway, but even better when synergising with solar fragments. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1840239774,679225683,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=4090651448,679225683,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1482024992,679225683,3017780555,4293542123

// Forbearance Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Countermass, High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. If you already have a shaped Forbearance from Vow of the Disciple, you can move along. If not, it's the current best-in-subfamily for stats. The most popular roll of a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine paired with Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction has been the add-clearing wave-frame of choice for the last few seasons, and should still be good even after the planned CR nerf. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Mountaintop Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Recombination, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Spec damage as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Auto-Loading Holster just works - reloading in your pocket while you're doing dame with your heavy. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but if you're firing eight or more shots over the course of a longer damage phase, you'll get more bonus damage from Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon, which also needs no setting up. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling if you get Blast Radius DO NOT MASTERWORK!, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Overflow puts two in the mag just for running over an ammo brick, or Ambitious Assassin does the same after a kill. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon provide a reliable +15%, with Frenzy also boosting your reload speed and handling. // Hammerhead Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Killing Tally, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686 with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss damage in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Hammerhead has lots of competition in the void Adaptive-frame LMG subfamily. It mostly has decent stats except for it's inventory size - at base you'll have 315 shots as opposed to Commemoration's 351. With three reserve mods, you'll have 427 compared to 453. You're best choice of barrel perk is something that helps with the low handling and, as a bigger magazine means more ammo from bricks, Appended or Extended are the mag perks for choice. As trait perks, Rewind Rounds delays your need to reload, so keeping you in a fight for longer while Killing Tally's persistent +30% damage for as long as you don't swap or reload is the standout damage perk. Or, alternatively, Surrounded will add +47% damage when enhanced after Last Shape. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hung Jury SR4 Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Kinetic Tremors, Explosive Payload, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4 Shiny, and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. The BRAVE Hung Jury offers Kinetic Tremors in the first trait perk column, which you can pair with another damage perk in the second - Explosive Payload just works all the time, or One For All is +35% damage when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hung Jury SR4 Shiny PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Rapid Hit, Enlightened Action, Explosive Payload, One For All, Desperate Measures, Firefly
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4 Shiny, and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. Only if you don't already have a well-rolled endgame scout rifle, you have a good choice of reload and damage trait perks in the first and second columns to choose from. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hung Jury SR4 Shiny PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4 Shiny, and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. Rewind Rounds does work well with Precision Instrument, if you can keep landing headshots - it's here as a roll, even if it's not the most reliable PvE damage boost. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hung Jury SR4 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Kinetic Tremors, Explosive Payload, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4, and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. The BRAVE Hung Jury offers Kinetic Tremors in the first trait perk column, which you can pair with another damage perk in the second - Explosive Payload just works all the time, or One For All is +35% damage when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hung Jury SR4 PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4, and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. Rewind Rounds does work well with Precision Instrument, if you can keep landing headshots - it's here as a roll, even if it's not the most reliable PvE damage boost. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Elsie's Rifle Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Frenzy, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. Probably more for void Gyrfalcon Hunters, with easy access to volatile rounds, Repulsor Brace gives you a high uptime on void overshields, while Frenzy or Desperate Measures are great damage boosting options. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Elsie's Rifle Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. If you're running a void subclass and not a Gyrfalcon Hunter, or if you're not running void and want access to some of the void verbs, Repulsor Brace gives you access to a void overshield for defeating targets made volatile by Destabilizing Rounds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Elsie's Rifle Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Rewind Rounds, Frenzy, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. Rewind Rounds extends your magazine in the first trait column to pair with the 15% damage boost from Frenzy plus 100 Handling and Reload Speed or up to +30% damage from Desperate Measures. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Recluse Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, Enlightened Action, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. For end-game add clearing, reload perks that don't need kills to proc, like Threat Detector or Enlightened Action would be your first choice, while Surrounded will be enhanceable in Final Shape for +47% damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
