// The Recluse Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. For void fragment synergy, or for access to void effects on another subclass, Repulsor Brace gives you access to void overshields, procced by killing enemies made volatile by Destabilizing Rounds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Recluse Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly for Gyrfalcon Hunters. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. For Gyrfalcon Hunters with easy access to Volatile Rounds, Repulsor Brace gives you access to void overshields, and works with any of the damage perks available. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. // The Recluse PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly for Gyrfalcon Hunters. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. For Gyrfalcon Hunters with easy access to Volatile Rounds, Repulsor Brace gives you access to void overshields, and works with any of the damage perks available. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Edge Transit Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Sticky Grenades, Cascade Point, Deconstruct
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The meme-machine is back and, although the stats are average, it's a beast for boss damage. Go for a barrel perk that boosts Velocity and Handling and then, unusually, Sticky Grenades is the top mag perk for this particularl roll bear with us. Either Field Prep or Cascade Point and Deconstruct together make this a great DPS choice. Either just take advantage of two extra reserve ammo and faster reload and handling from Field Prep, or proc Cascade Point with a couple of sniper crits and to proc the higher fire rate, while Deconstruct with Sticky Grenades pulls bonus ammo out of the air on every second, rather than every third, hit because of the delay before the explosive damage. This extends your effective magazine size to 11, but only using 6 ammo. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3373736292,3751912585,3993379141

dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3798852852,3373736292,2869569095,3993379141

// Edge Transit Shiny PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The meme-machine is back and, although the stats are average, it's a beast for boss damage. Reducing the blast radium with Hard Launch does boost impact damage a little, otherwise go for a barrel perk that boosts Velocity and Handling, and Spike Grenades adds a little extra impact damage too. As the first trait perk, Envious Assassin can overfill the magazine to 18, which you can use with Bait and Switch's +30% damage bonus for some serious boss damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Slammer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Chain Reaction, Cold Steel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Slammer is our first vortex frame Stasis sword, with the same stats as its peers. Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For add clearing, the trait perk combination, that's unique to The Slammer, of Chain Reaction and Cold Steel spreads slow stacks which you can improve with Stasis subclass fragments with the add kill explosions and, when enhanced, Cold Steel also adds a useful 10 to the inventory stat for additional ammo reserves. You'll probably find more use for the Vanguard's Vindication origin trait, unless there's a champion mod around for swords that works with Stunning Recovery. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Prophet PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away, Explosive Payload, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, Explosive Payload is, again, probably best or Precision Instrument can be okay if you're hitting your headshots. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Prophet PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, you should be able to create Stasis crystals easily enough, to synergise with the subclass fragments, but they'll be a long way away! Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Prophet Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away, Explosive Payload, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, Explosive Payload is, again, probably best or Precision Instrument can be okay if you're hitting your headshots. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Prophet Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, you should be able to create Stasis crystals easily enough, to synergise with the subclass fragments, but they'll be a long way away! Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Summoner PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Heal Clip and Incandescent can both be improved by solar subclass fragments, but even without them will cure 120 health for you and 60 for Guardians around you for reloading after a kill, and Incandescent spreads scorch and ignites enemies. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Perpetual Motion is just a useful all-around boost to gunfeel to pair with a second column damage perk like Onslaught the extra stability is hand to control the recoil at three stacks, Golden Tricorn or Target Lock. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Multimach CCX PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds, Attrition Orbs, Under Over, Frenzy, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. MultiMach CCX has the lightweight frame's +20 Mobility and +6.25% speed bonus, and the stats are great - it's just a shame there's nothing here to get excited about for PvE. If you must really?, look for stability to help with keeping shots on target and then - are you absolutely insisting still? - Attrition Orbs or Under Over in the first trait perk column, and Frenzy with Kinetic Tremors in a distant second. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Tusk of the Boar PvE first-choice roll
// Quickl Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Slideways, Grave Robber, Enlighted Action, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. Use the first trait perk to bypass or improve the reload - Slideways is best, but Grave Robber or Enlightened Action can work too. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Tusk of the Boar PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Slice, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with Hunters on Strand subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column Slice is very useful against harder-hitting enemies to sever them and reduce their damage output - it's easiest to proc with the Hunter dodge and can be improved with Thread of Continuity. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing and spread sever over a wider area. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3525010810,2822142346,923806249,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=3798852852,2822142346,923806249,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=981914802,2822142346,923806249,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1441682018,2822142346,923806249,2396489472

// Adjudicator PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Adjudicator has decent stats and, with a precision frame, you don't need to worry too much about the published Recoil Direction. A little extra stability helps keep bullets on target, and a little extra range is nice, so Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling can help out, or Chambered Compensator can take Recoil Direction to 100 as well as adding stability, You'll be emptying the mag a lot, so reload speed is the magazine perk choice - Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell all help. In the first trait column as the support park, Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector and Subsistence all speed up reload as well as bumping up other useful stats, or delay the need to reload. With Frenzy procced in the second perk column, you'll have a 15% damage boost, snappy handling and lightning fast reloads. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom - Subsistence kills keeps feeding ammo into the bottom half of the mag to extend the time the extra damage is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Prosecutor PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Extended Barrel, High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. Rewind Rounds is a cunning plan to take advantage of the origin trait's bottom of the mag damage boost by continually refreshing the bottom half of the mag, while Frenzy adds a reliable 15% damage boost and maxes out your handling and reload speed. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Prosecutor PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Extended Barrel, High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. Rewind Rounds is a cunning plan to take advantage of the origin trait's bottom of the mag damage boost by continually refreshing the bottom half of the mag, while Golden Tricorn's second damage stack is easy to proc with the Arc 3.0 toolkit, for a very hefty 50% damage boost. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Judgment PvE first-choice roll
// Fastdraw HCS, Steadyhand HCS, Truesight HCS, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag, Headstone, Timed Payload, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Judgment is back in a new Stasis form, although the stats are showing its age. On the plus side, you do still have Sight perks rather than barrels to choose from - Fastdraw, Steadyhand and Truesight all help to round out stats nicely. You can help reload speed with the mag perk - Tactical Mag is the top pick, but Flared Magwell or even Alloy Mag can work too. It's very unusual to see Headstone in the first trait perk slot, creating crystals to synergise with the Stasis fragments. Timed Payload looks interesting, although splitting impact and explosive damage might not play well with Headstone. Alternatively Adrenaline Junkie, when procced, will mean any Headstone crystals you create will share the same damage buffs when shattered. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Relentless PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Full Bore, Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Slice, Feenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Relentless returns as a Strand pulse rifle with below average stats that reveal its Season 1 origin. The recoil direction of 65 is vertical, if a little loose, so you either look to improve it further or, if you can handle the recoil, push out the range with your barrel perk. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour. You don't need to run a strand subclass but if you do then Slice as the first trait perk can sever enemies to reduce their damage output very useful in a boss fight to help your fireteam, to synergise with Thread of Continuity. As the second trait perk, Frenzy provides a reliable passive 15% damage boost and maximises handling and reload speed stats. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Darkest Before PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Heal Clip, Subsistence, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Solar subclass. Darkest Before is back in a solar, rather than arc configuration, with the same strong stat package as before. The recoil direction of 64 is pretty controllable, but if you want to make it even more reliable, Arrowhead Brake will take it to 94. If you're happy with the recoil, there's no harm in pushing out the range with your barrel perk instead. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour, or Light Mag and Flared Magwell improve reload speed. Looking at One For All as the second trait perk, you can use the 35% damage boost to mow through enemies while, as the first trait perk, you either Cure yourself and your fireteam with Heal Clip, or automatically top up your magazine with Subsistence. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Reprised and new Guardian Games 2024 weapons
@description:Season 23 refreshed Guardian Games weapons with Classy Contender origin trait

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk passively boosts PvE damage. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Precision Instrument can boost damage against beefier minors on successive crits in the second column as the signature perk. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Enlighened Action, Keep Away, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag. In the first trait column as your support perk, you can choose Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size Enlightened Action to boost reload speed and handling, or Keep Away for easier crit hits, while Hatchling can boost damage with spawned Threadlings in the second column as the second column signature perk, particularly when using the Rebirth fragment. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Gutshot Straight, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag. If you get the combination of Gutshot Straight and Explosive Payload in the first and second trait columns, it might be worth hanging on to as there's a weird interaction that passively boosts body shot damage by +38% and crit damage by 16%. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Fluid Barrel Polygonal Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Collective Action, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Title has decent stats in a crowded and competitive subfamily, including vertical recoil of 85 and 15 zoom, where 14 is the norm. Use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or stability, and the the combat effect magazine perks all have a place, or just look to boost reload speed with Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell. If you're looking for a workhorse void SMG, Threat Detector or Perpetual Motion in the first trait column to round out stats and boost reload, combined with Collective Action or Surrounded in the second for a solid damage boost will serve you well. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Hakke Breach Armaments adds damage to vehicles and constructs, but that's probably not as useful here. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Fluid Barrel Polygonal Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Pugilist, Grave Robber, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for melee builds. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Title has decent stats in a crowded and competitive subfamily, including vertical recoil of 85 and 15 zoom, where 14 is the norm. Use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or stability, and the the combat effect magazine perks all have a place, or just look to boost reload speed with Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell. If you're building around a melee gamestyle, in the first trait column you should be looking at Pugilist or Grave Robber to pair with Swashbuckler in the second. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Hakke Breach Armaments adds damage to vehicles and constructs, but that's probably not as useful here. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Fluid Barrel Polygonal Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Repulsor Brace, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for Gyrfalcon Hunters. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Title has decent stats in a crowded and competitive subfamily, including vertical recoil of 85 and 15 zoom, where 14 is the norm. Use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or stability, and the the combat effect magazine perks all have a place, or just look to boost reload speed with Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell. Gyrfalcon void Hunters can already apply volatile rounds at will so kills to proc Repulsor Brace in the first trait column will be easy - but be aware this overrides the Void reserve Shield so you don't get the boost to class ability regeneration - but you do get the origin trait boost instead. In CQC you'll probably find the Overshield damage reduction really useful anyway, especially when paired with void fragments like Echo of Persistence. With the second column, as you don't need Destabilizing Rounds, Surrounded is a great passive boost to damage - up to 47% when you're able to enhance the perk. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful in the play loop to get your dodge back faster - Hakke Breach Armaments adds damage to vehicles and constructs, but that's probably not as useful here. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Hullabaloo PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Only the second heavy wave-frame GL, so there's not a big pool to compare against, but it's noticeable that Hullabaloo has lower inventory stat than Dimensional Hypotrochoid, so you can't carry a many reserves and don't get as many shots per heavy brick. There's not much to tinker with stats-wise with the barrel and mag perks - we're looking for velocity, handling and reload speed. Field Prep in the first trait column makes up somewhat for the inventory stat, and when it's enhanced it's only one shot away from max ammo, without the need for any reserve mods one would get you to the max. Chain Reaction in the second column makes this your heavy Forbearance for crowd control - you should be able to wipe out add-dense areas or spawns in end-game activities. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2869569095,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2869569095,2396489472

// Hullabaloo PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Voltshot, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with arc subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Only the second heavy wave-frame GL, so there's not a big pool to compare against, but it's noticeable that Hullabaloo has lower inventory stat than Dimensional Hypotrochoid, so you can't carry a many reserves and don't get as many shots per heavy brick - you'll likely need to run some ammo reserve mods. There's not much to tinker with stats-wise with the barrel and mag perks - we're looking for reload speed, velocity, and handling. For a little arc synergy, but mostly for the extra jolt lethality, Voltshot is a very fun option for the first trait column, working with Sparks of Ions and Discharge from the arc kit. Chain Reaction in the second column makes this your heavy Forbearance for crowd control - with the two traits in combination, you should be able to wipe out add-dense areas or spawns of even beefy enemies in end-game activities. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2173046394,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2173046394,2396489472

// Marcato-45 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Threat Detector, Triple Tap, Demolitionist, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Marcato-45 stars off with decent stats in comparison to its peers - although it has a small magazine, it compensates by having fairly hefty reserves. You'll need to keep the reticule on target, so choose a barrel perk that improves recoil direction or stability. Reload speed and mag size will also be important, so this is what to look for with the magazine perk choice. In the first trait column, Threat Detector, Triple Tap and Demolitionist are all good for either speeding up reloads or extending your magazine, while Onslaught will mow through minor adds, and be good for occasional burst damage against majors too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Marcato-45 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Marcato-45 stars off with decent stats in comparison to its peers - although it has a small magazine, it compensates by having fairly hefty reserves. You'll need to keep the reticule on target, so choose a barrel perk that improves recoil direction or stability. Reload speed and mag size will also be important, so this is what to look for with the magazine perk choice. Combine Slice, in the first trait column, to reduce damage output by 40% from bulkier adds with Hatchling for additional crowd control, and throw in supportive fragments to augment both, and this could be a fun add-suppressing and add-clearing roll. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Season 23 Playlist weapons
@description:Season of the Wish drops from Vanguard, Crucible and Gambit activities 

// Undercurrent PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance or maybe even in addition to. The stats are worse - but it's not an end-game weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber physics be damned after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=981914802,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394

// Undercurrent Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance or maybe even in addition to. The stats are worse - but it's not a Raid or Trials weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber physics be damned after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting Minor, Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=3798852852,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=981914802,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=1441682018,2822142346,2010801679,2173046394

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you need a waepon for boss damage, then Jagged Edge provides the most damage as a Blade perk, but decimates your ammo, so Honed Edge and Tempered Edge might be attractive alternatives, and Swordmaster's Guard provides a little bit of everything as the guard perk. For reliable boss damage, if you haven't got anything better, Relentless Strikes in the first trait column as the support perk refunds ammo after three hits, while either Whirlwind Blade provides an escalating 3% damage per hit topping off at +30% or, if you know there are other minor adds about, Surrounded boosts damage by a hefty 40%. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=2827049491,269888150,1749209109,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=105164264&perks=938542991,269888150,1749209109,3708227201

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Honed Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Unrelenting, Surrounded, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you don't have a sword that's rolled for add clear, increase the ammo you're carrying even at the cost of impact - Minor adds will die anyway with your blade perk. Swordmaster's Guard provides an all-round boost to stats in the guard slot. For your support perk in the first trait slot, you could boost ammo reserves with Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes, or regenerate health with Unrelenting. For your signature perk in the second trait slot. Surrounded or One For All both boost damage, in case you come up against something a bit bulkier. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun, or just take the little bits of health from Vanuard's Vindication. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Double-Edged Answer PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Honed Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you don't have a sword that's rolled for add clear, increase the ammo you're carrying even at the cost of impact - Minor adds will die anyway with your blade perk. Swordmaster's Guard provides an all-round boost to stats in the guard slot. For your support perk in the first trait slot, Repulsor Brace will provide a very handy void overshield when procced, while in the second, you can either take advantage of void abilities and use Surrounded in CQC or Destabilizing Rounds to apply a cloud of volatility. Either way, subclass fragments like Echo of Persistence, can build into subclass verbs. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun, or just take the little bits of health from Vanuard's Vindication. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retrofuturist PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Unrelenting, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. If you're planning to wade into groups of adds, them the trait combination of Unrelenting and Frenzy should keep you alive and killing for as long as you have ammo. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For an add clearing weapon, pair Subsistence in the first trait column as the support perk and Killing Tally ini the second as the signature perk. You'll get an untimed +30% damage bonus after three kills, with those kills partially refilling the magazine. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Envious Assassin, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For a backup weapon to use against bosses, Envious Assassin can load a ridiculous 260 charges in your battery after 15 kills with other weapons, which means you can reach the upper +40% stack of Target Lock's damage boost with sustained fire against a target. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Incisor PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Slice, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For a weapon to use as part of a Bait and Switch rotation against a boss, Slide as the first trait column support perk reduces the target's damage output by 40% when procced by a class ability, while Target Lock provides a progressive damage boost for when you run out of heavy ammo. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Lethal Abundance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Lethal Abundance has decent stats, but as a High-Impact frame auto rifle this isn't going to be on too many people's wish list. as a subfamily, they generally have poor handling and reload speed, so that's what to boost in the barrel and mag perk slots. For Strand synergy, Slice and Hatchling in the two trait columns give you the two perks to work with using your aspects and fragments. Slice also makes this a good swap weapon in a Bait and Switch rotation, applying 40% reduction in damage output from affected targets when procced after using your class ability. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Lethal Abundance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag, Slice, Enlightened Action, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Lethal Abundance has decent stats, but as a High-Impact frame auto rifle this isn't going to be on too many people's wish list. as a subfamily, they generally have poor handling and reload speed, so that's what to boost in the barrel and mag perk slots. In the first trait column, Slice is useful when facing tankier enemies, applying 40% reduction in damage output from affected targets when procced after using your class ability, which also makes this a good swap weapon in a Bait and Switch rotation. Alternatively, Enlightened Action boosts both handling and reload speed just for hitting a target. Pairing that with Onslaught in the second trait column should help mow through groups of minor spec adds. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Breakneck PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Subsistence, Enlightened Action, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Breakneck is back, and has very solid stats, although it looks like we're never going to see the OG and OP Rampage/ Onslaught version again, As a precision frame AR, you don't need to worry about recoil direction, so if you're considering an alternative roll bumps to any combination of the stats should feel good in choosing barrel perk options. Any of the combat effect magazines add utility and then, in the first trait column, you can choose between Subsistence to keep your magazine topped off and Enlightened Action for better handling and reload speed. In the second column, Kinetic Tremors helps with crowd control around a target. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Range, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

@title:Season 23 Seasonal weapons
@description:Season of the Wish seasonal weapons, with the Dragon's Vengeance origin trait 

// Appetence PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Overflow, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Appetence which means "a natural craving, desire or affinity", seeing as you're asking is the first legendary Stasis trace rifle. It has decent stats, and some interesting trait combinations. Take your pick of handling and/or stability and maybe a touch of recoil direction, if you need it to be a perfect 100, for the barrel perk. With an eye on Overflow as the support perk in the first trait column, Ionized Battery maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow gives you 229 in the battery, and 476 total ammo so 247 in reserve with no Reserve mods, up to 606 with three. Killing Tally is the best of the damage perks here, providing a 30% non-timed damage boost as long as you don't swap weapons. With Overflow topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, this could mean a pretty-much permanent bonus damage. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1840239774,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=1392496348,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=3661387068,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=839105230,1483536627,3643424744,557221067
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=4090651448,1483536627,3643424744,557221067

// Scatter Signal PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Enhanced Battery, Overflow, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies, or fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Scatter Signal is perhaps one of the best weapons for burst damage as at v7.3.0.5 - great all-round stats as well as offering excellent trait combinations. Controlling recoil, with nine bolts, is important, as is snappiness - Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up recoil direction, but you might consider Fluted Barrel for the combination of handling and stability instead. Enhanced Battery gives the same number of charges 8 as Ionized so, with one eye on Overflow, maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow will take your battery to 18 charges - you'll have one left in reserve. Adding two Reserve mods takes this to three reserve shots, and with Overflow topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, you might never need to reload. Controlled Burst reduces charge time to 414 and boosts damage by 20% for hitting all your bolts. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=839105230,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=1840239774,2680121939,3643424744,2594592626

// Scatter Signal PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Enhanced Battery, Slice, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Scatter Signal is perhaps one of the best weapons for burst damage as at v7.3.0.5 - great all-round stats as well as offering excellent trait combinations. Controlling recoil, with nine bolts, is important, as is snappiness - Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up recoil direction, but you might consider Fluted Barrel for the combination of handling and stability instead. Enhanced Battery gives the same number of charges 8 as Ionized, without any reload penalty. Slice, as the first trait column perk, when procced after using your class ability reduces outgoing damage from a target by 40% for 8s - increased by 50% with the Thread of Continuity fragment, whether or not they're immune - very useful in boss fights or as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation. Controlled Burst as the second trait perk reduces charge time to 414 and boosts damage by 20% for hitting all your bolts. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=839105230,2680121939,923806249,2594592626
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=1840239774,2680121939,923806249,2594592626

// Supercluster PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Slice, Surrounded, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Shapeable. Supercluster is the first Strand pinpoint slug shotgun, and the good news is it has very competitive stats. The bad news is that they're not as great as they were a few years ago for boss DPS. Use the barrel perk to boost range and the mag perk to improve its utility - your preference between Assault Mag or Tactical Mag, or Appended Mag. Slice, as the first trait column perk, when procced after using your class ability reduces outgoing damage from a target by 40%, whether or not they're immune - very useful in boss fights or as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation. For a damage boosting perk in the second trait slot, choose between Surrounded, if you're likely to be in CQC with extra adds, or Vorpal Weapon for a reliable 15% boost to damage against Majors and Bosses. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting Boiss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Lethophobia PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Flexible String, Polymer String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Successful Warm-Up, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Minor spec add clearing in general content. Shapeable. Lethophobia or "fear of forgetting", seeing as you're asking offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed as the Lightweight Frame bonus but, honestly the stats are poor and it's difficult to recommend for PvE. If you do want to try it out, the tactic with Bowstrong and Arrow perks is to reduce the draw time and improve accuracy. As the support perk in the first trait column, Successful Warm up improves draw time further, although you don't have to get a kill first, Explosive Head in the second as the signature perk is the reliable boost to damage and flinch that it always is. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Doomed Petitioner PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Ionized Battery, Envious Assassin, Precision Instrument, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss spec damage in end-game content. Shapeable. Although Doomed Petitioner's stats are on the low side, if you don't already have a LFR for sustained boss damage, this will do nicely. A touch of stability and recoil direction from Chambered Compensator or Arrowhead Brake, and a maximised battery size of 6 with Ionized Battery sets you up nicely for Envious Assassin in the first trait column. Enhanced Envious Assassin will load 18 shots into the battery, leaving you 1 in reserve 2 with one Reserve mod, or 4 with two or three mods. You can choose between Enhanced Precision Instrument for 30% bonus damage after 6 crit hits or Enhanced Surrounded useful against Ir Yut for +47% damage when you're in a crowd. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting Boiss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// taken from https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep91-pt2-dreaming-city-weapons.txt

@title:Season 23 Dreaming City weapons
@description:Reprised weapons, with the Advanced Reflexes origin trait

// Tigerspite PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Tigerspite has fairly middle-of-the-road stats and a more PvP-oriented trait pool but, if you like the subtype then there are a few interesting rolls. As with all precision weapon subtypes, you can start by not worrying too much about recoil direction, so you might as well push out the range with your barrel perk option. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Subsistence really is the best maybe only trait that works for PvE while Frenzy is easy to proc and adds +15% damage, and 100 Handling and Reload, once it's procced. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
