// Waking Vigil PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Kinetic Tremors, Attrition Orbs, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. As a former Lightweight HC that's been crowbarred into the Adaptive subfamily, the stats look very weird, with low range and stability but high handling and reload speed. If you haven't already got a decent arc hand cannon, then you could push out the range a bit, even at the cost of a little Handling, and add a little Stability. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. Rapid Hit is the best support perk choice in the first column traits, although Perpetual Motion isn't bad either. Although you don't need Ionic Traces specifically to use Collective Action as the signature perk in the second trait column, they have the advantage over other elemental pickups in end-game content of tracking to you automatically, rather than having to go out to collect them, for a solid +20% damage boost for 7s. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag, Rapid Hit Fourth Time's the Charm, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling not such a problem with the origin trait and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. Then, either Rapid Hit or Fourth Time's The Charm in the first, support, trait slot work well with Golden Tricorn in the second - you should be able to proc the second tier +50% damage with a void grenade to help deal with chunkier minor adds and the occasional major. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Vouchsafe PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag, Rapid Hit, Explosive Payload, Dragonfly, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling not such a problem with the origin trait and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. Slot in Rapid Hit for the first trait column's support perk and then in the second you can improve on the curated roll's Explosive Payload, add a little crowd clearance with Dragonfly, or use elemental pickups to proc Collective Action although you might need to travel a fair way to collect them if you're engaging at typical scout rifle distances. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Retold Tale PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. For your trait combination, this is the first pellet shotgun that offers the the trait combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds for aggressive CQC add clearing. You don't need a void subclass to make use of them - they'll work perfectly well without - but you can improve the effect with void fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling or +20 charge rate with swords, for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Twilight Oath PvE first-choice roll
// Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Envious Assassin, Precision Instrument, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Twilight Oath starts in last place for stats amongst its peers, but it has one trick up its sleeve to make it useful for boss damage, if you don't already have a well-rolled special weapon for when you run out of heavy ammo. You'll need to start out by taming the wonky recoil with a Recoil Direction or Stability barrel perk. Tactical Mag, Appended Mag and Extended Mag all get you to the maximum of 7 shots - Tactical Mag adds some useful additional Stability too. You can use this with the trait combination of Envious Assassin, which can get 18 shots after 14 primary/heavy kills and up to 21 if you reproc, together with Precision Instrument, which provides a scaling damage bonus of up to +25% damage on the sixth and every subsequent crit hit. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abide the Return PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Balanced Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you already have a solar boss damage sword, you can pass. If you want to use Abide the Return, then get a blade perk that increases damage and, for a guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard speeds up your heavy attack regeneration or Balanced Guard gives you a little bit of everything to help survive in CQC with a boss. The usual trait combination of Relentless Strikes, returning one ammo for everyth three light hits, and Whirlwind Blade for an escalating +3% bump to damage topping off at +30% for landing light hits makes for a decent, if not top-tier option for boss DPS phases. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +20 charge rate for faster heavy attacks, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abide the Return PvE first-choice roll
// Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Balanced Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. If you already have a solar boss damage sword, you can pass. If you don't, then maybe consider trying to craft a Caretaker from Dares of Eternity before settling. If you want to use Abide the Return, then get a blade perk that increases ammo and reserves adds will die to a single hit anyway and, for a guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard speeds up your heavy attack regeneration or Balanced Guard gives you a little bit of everything to help survive in CQC. The usual trait combination of Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes to extend your ammo and Incandescent to help with add clear, should make room clearing easy. You don't need to use a solar subclass but you can improve scorch and ignite verbs further with your fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +20 charge rate for faster heavy attacks, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Alloy Casing, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. If you're going that way, you could maximise the Blast Radius with Volatile Launch as the barrel perk, and then boost Velocity with High-Velocity Rounds or reload Speed with Alloy Casing in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=1478423395,2985827016,2869569095,2396489472

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Black Poweder, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, you could boost Blast Radius and Velocity with Linear Compensator as the barrel perk, and then boost Blast Radius with Black Powder in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Field Prep, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, and you're lucky enough to get a Blast Radius masterwork, you can boost velocity and reload speed with Quick Launch in the barrel and High-Velocity Rounds in the mag. You might as well have as many rockets to shoots as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves by one and reload speed further, as the first trait perk to support Chain Reaction in the second to really make sure that everything in the blast radius is dead. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2869569095,2396489472

// Sleepless PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, Field Prep, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Like other High-Impact Rocket Launchers with their high blast radius, Sleepless really only has one role, and that's add clearing - maybe for Gunsmith bounties. You might be better off waiting until you can craft a Semiotician with enchanced versions of the traits, but if you can't wait, maximise the Blast Radius with Volatile Launch and Black Powder in the barrel and mag, and a Blast Radius Masterwork to start with. You might as well have as many rockets to shoot as you can, so Field Prep boosts your reserves and helps with reload speed, as the first trait perk to support Bipod - with all of this you'll have 15 rockets loading two at a time that still have 90 Blast Radius and a decent reload speed when crouched. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2140635451&perks=1478423395,1996142143,2869569095,1439600632

// taken from https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep91-pt1-dawning-weapons.txt

@title:Season 23 Dawning weapons
@description:New weapons and reprised, with the Dawning Surprise origin trait

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Stats For All, One For All
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Like most world-drop weapons, Cold Front has pretty poor stats - including a stability of just 7, although excluding Immortal, which is a stat monster, they're average for the frame subtype. Use the barrel and mag perks to help out with this and then the SOFA Stats/ One For All combination of trait perks to round out the stats further and add a chunky 35% bonus damage. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10sand grants energy 10% to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Perprtual Motion, Unrelenting, Frenzy
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Like most world-drop weapons, Cold Front has pretty poor stats - including a stability of just 7, although excluding Immortal, which is a stat monster, they're average for the frame subtype. Use the barrel and mag perks to help out with this. As the first trait column support perk, Perpetual Motion adds further stat bonuses just for moving, or Unrelenting's bonus health is useful in CQC, while in the second column as the signature perk, Frenzy boosts the handling and reload speed up to 100 and adds 15% bonus damage when procced. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants energy 10% to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. // Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Damage in end-game content. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Extended Mag or Appended Mag both work as mag perks giving you more continuous shots on a single target. In the first trait column, as the support perk, the rounds that Rewind Rounds refills will count towards proccing the highest tiers of Target Lock as the second trait perk for sustained damage against a single target. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Avalanche PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Subsistence, Incandescent
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for chunkier add-clearing against Minor Spec Enemies in general content with a solar subclass. The stats are okay overall - there are a could of surprises with 90 Aim Assist and 19 Zoom, which are a lot higher than its peers - but unfortunately Avalanche has the lowest ammo reserves of any adaptive which limits its usefulness. If you already have a decent solar LMG, then you can pass. If you don't, Arrowhead Brake cleans up the recoil direction to 100, or Smallbore or Fluted Barrel boost useful stats as the barrel perk. Then, Appended Mag, Extended Mag or Flared Magwell both work as mag perks giving you more continuous shots on a single target. To use as a heavy scort rifle for add-clearing, In the first trait column, as the support perk, the rounds that Rewind Rounds or Subsistence refills save time on reloads, while Incandescent helps you tie into solar subclass fragments to assist with add-clearing. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. // Vengeful Whisper PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Slice, Collective Action
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Strand Synergy in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Vengeful Whisper is no exception - even going as far as an extra point of zoom over other precision bows. This also has traits appearing in non-standard columns to make for some unique rolls. As with every bow, the aim is to reduce draw time first, and improve accuracy second - Elastic String does the first job and Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching does the second. The combination of Slice in the first trait column and Collective Action in the second makes this a bit of a Swiss-army knife of weapons. Slice, with Strand of Continuity, Severs an enemy to reduce their damage output by 40% for 15s - you can use this effect on Majors and Bosses, even during an immunity phase to grant an effective 40% damage reduction for your whole fireteam. Or, apply Sever to a minor and kill it to spawn a Tangle that you can use with Collective Action for a 20% damage boost for 7s, then rinse and repeat. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3827198035,923806249,3324494224
dimwishlist:item=839344841&perks=2801223209,3429800428,923806249,3324494224

// Naeem's Lance PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, Precision Instrument
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Naeem's Lance is no exception - having pretty good overall stats. It's the first Rapid-fire Sniper so, as is common for most snipers, Handling is a crucial stat but, as this is a rapid-fire frame, you'll also need to tidy up the recoil direction, so Arrowhead Brake is the barrel perk choice. As the mag perk, Tactical Mag is the best option, as it boosts stability a bit too, and gives the same rounds in the mag as Appended and Extended Mag. For the first trait, Reconstruction doubles your mag size passively while, if you don't have a good backup sniper for boss damage when you run out of heavy ammo, Precision Instrument boosts your damage output by 25% after six shots, for the rest of the 14-round magazine. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,106909392,1523832109,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2806569825&perks=839105230,2420895100,1523832109,555281244

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Stasis synergy and add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. Enlightened Action will get you pretty close to maxed out Handling and Reload at 5 stacks, or Demolitionist is difficult to turn down when it shows up in the first trait column as the support perk. In the second as the signature perk, you should be able to proc Collective Action's 20% damage bonus from generating Stasis shards with Hunters and Titans Warlocks may have to work harder, or any other elemental pickup. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. In the second trait slot as the signature perk, you won't ever get to the higher damage tiers of Target Lock, even with the instant reload from throwing a grenade with Demolitionist in the first column support perk slot, but it's still a combination of a decent boost for sustained damage and grenade energy. Or just be happy with the a reliably fast reload and great handling with Enlightened Action at 5 stacks. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Horror Story PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Accurized Rounds, Demolitionist, Frenzy, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Horror Story has returned and become a stasis precision auto-rifle - the first of its subtype. The stats are unexceptional, as you might expect from an event weapon but there are some trait combinations to save it. Recoil direction doesn't really matter on a precision-frame weapon, and stability is less important with a more reliable recoil direction, so you can choose your pick of Handling, Range and Reload Speed from your barrel and mag perks. In the first trait slot as the support perk, it's difficult to look past Demolitionist. To pair with it as the second column signature perk, Frenzy provides +15% damage and maxes out handling and reload speed, or Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing - a grenade kill will boost damage by 33%, and the kills you get with refresh your grenade energy. Both origin traits are more PvP-orientated, but Nadir Focus's extra range and accuracy for free is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Jurassic Green PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accurized Rounds, Heal Clip, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for solar synergy and Minor Spec add-clearing in end-game content. Jurassic Green is a solar rapid-fire pulse, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty. It's got a similar stat range to its other world-drop peers, but comes a poor second to end-game drops in the energy slot. The recoil direction is a frankly awful 50 at base. The best even Arrowhead Brake can do is bring it up to a not entirely awful 80. Looking at the traits for this roll, the best option is to just increase the range with Accurized Rounds. The new to season 22 Heal Clip in the first trait column as the support perk will apply one stack of Cure to you and anyone else near on reloading after a kill, while Frenzy in the second column as the signature perk boosts handling and reload speed to 100, and adds 15% damage when procced. The Field Tested origin trait will just work steadily in the background to gradually improve your gunfeel, as long as you don't die! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Acosmic PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Loose Change, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 83 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4ISDC0TSrLmfEyPuI9oU2m?si=9fbd5a7cf0bc4f07 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add-clearing in end-game content. Grenade launchers may not be anyone's first choice for add clearing, but Acosmic named after one of the two Hindu aspects of god; to be acosmic is to deny the objective reality of the temporal world - transcendental in a world-negating sense, according to Merriam-Webster is a void rapid-fire frame GL, with the intrinsic 20% faster reload when its magazine is empty, and is a viable option.. Get your blast radius as high as possible with your barrel and mag perks, so you can catch as many adds as possible with your shots. In the first trait column as the support perk, new to season 22 Loose Change boosts reload speed by 50 when you apply an elemental debuff, which is just what Destabilizing Rounds in the second column as the signature perk does. You should be able to clear crowded rooms fast and soften up beefier enemies. The Nadir Focus origin trait boosts your shot velocity further, which is a nice little bonus. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag or damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Swordbreaker PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Assault Mag, Pugilist, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy and add clearing chunkier Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. Swordbreaker is back as a strand shotgun, has good stats - particularly the ones that matter most - and like all lightweights offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed. As with most shotguns, Handling matters most, so Barrel Shroud or Cockscrew Rifling both offer bumps as the barrel park. For the mag perk, Assault Mag increases rate-of-fire, which is always useful. To make the most of the Cursed Thrall origin trait, which synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active, Pugilist is an obvious choice in the first trait column as the support perk, regenerating melee energy on weapon kills. In the second, Golden Tricorn can help you make the most of the Strand melee abilities you're going to be in CQC, with a shotgun, setting yourself up for +50% damage for chunkier minors and the occasional major, and Cursed Thrall explosions on a kill. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Abyss Defiant PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Enlightened Action, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. High Impact Auto-Rifles aren't really first choice for PvE - they do have good range, and the frame intrinsic provides more accuracy when stationary or slow-moving, but Abyss Defiant has great stats and trait combinations, so may be worth a try. Handling is always low on HIs, so Fluted Barrel is your top barrel perk choice, although Arrowhead Brake does take recoil direction to 100, so is a decent option as well. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell rounds out a few more gunfeel stats, or take the combat effect mag perk of your choice. For end-game activities, Enlightened Action in the first trait slot as the support perk provides passive boosts to reload and handling, which you should hit max stacks of quickly, and Collective Action in the second column as the signature perk is a reliable 20% damage boost for collecting an elemental pickup. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Oversoul Edict PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Enlightened Action, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Arc synergy add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in general content. Shapeable. Oversoul Edict offers the usual rapid-fire intrinsic 20% faster reload animation when the mag is empty and middling stats by comarison with energy slot peers. Controlling the recoil direction means Arrowhead Brake is the best barrel perk, taking it to an almost not terrible 79. Take your choice of rounding out some of the gunfeel stats with Flared Magwell, or any of the combat effect magazine perks. In the first trait column as the support perk, Enlightened Action will take the base handling to 82 and reload speed to 84 within two bursts, if every shot hits. This will mean a fast reload to proc Voltshot after a kill to apply Jolt on enemies and tie in with your arc verbs. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Oversoul Edict PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Arc synergy add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in end-age content. Shapeable. Oversoul Edict offers the usual rapid-fire intrinsic 20% faster reload animation when the mag is empty and middling stats by comarison with energy slot peers. Controlling the recoil direction means Arrowhead Brake is the best barrel perk, taking it to an almost not terrible 79. Take your choice of rounding out some of the gunfeel stats with Flared Magwell, or any of the combat effect magazine perks. In the first trait column as the support perk, Demolitionist is as great as always for regenerating grenade energy and Adrenaline Junkie in the second column as the signature perk lets you use those grenades for a +33% damage after a kill. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Word of Crota PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Full Bore, Accurized Rounds, Dragonfly, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in end-age content. Shapeable. Word of Crota drops with perfect recoil direction made even more perfect, if that's possible, by the intrinsic frame trait and best-in-slot stats so is definitely worth a look. You can use the barrel and mag perks to fill out range and stability - we can address the handling and reload speed with our signature perk. It's difficult to turn down two damage traits when they're offered so Dragonfly in the first trait column as the support perk will help spread damage in crowds of adds, and Frenzy grants a passive 15% damage boost together with +50 to Reload Speed and Handling. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Song of Ir Yt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Appended Mag, Flared Magwell, Unrelenting, Sword Logic
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear against chunkier Minor Spec enemies and the occasional major in end-game content. Shapeable. There's a lot of competition in the arc LMGs, and Song of Ir Yt has lower than average stats but saves itself with some nice trait perk combinations. Handling makes most weapons feel better - Fluted Barrel adds the most, but Arrowhead Brake also helps max out the recoil direction in the barrel perk slot. For the magazine perk, you can choose the combat effect mag of your preference, or maybe go with Appended Mag or Flared Magwell to round out the stats further. As the first trait column support perk, Unrelenting as the second column signature perk is great in end-game content for healing you and keeping you in a fight. You've got a pretty big mag, so you can use it to start and then escalate the new-to-season-22 Sword Logic perk damage tiers to rip through Minor Spec adds and the occasional Major. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Song of Ir Yt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Sword Logic
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear against chunkier Minor Spec enemies and the occasional major in end-game content. Shapeable. There's a lot of competition in the arc LMGs, and Song of Ir Yt has lower than average stats but saves itself with some nice trait perk combinations. Handling makes most weapons feel better - Fluted Barrel adds the most, but Arrowhead Brake also helps max out the recoil direction in the barrel perk slot. Maximise your magazine size with Extended Mag or Appended Mag as the perk, and then in the first column as the support perk, you can then make the most of this with Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction so you can essentially keep firing til you run out of ammo. With this set-up, you can start and then escalate the new-to-season-22 Sword Logic perk damage tiers to rip through Minor Spec adds and Majors, and even an occasional boss. Maybe not so useful with this roll, but the Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Range, with a damage boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

//originally found at https://github.com/Adamsdown-Boy/destiny-rolls/blob/main/player-versus-enemies-rolls/ep78-s22-foundry-weapons.txt

@title:Season 22 Foundry Athenaeum Ritual Table and World drop weapons, and reprised craftable exotics
@description:Season of the Witch Cassoid and Nadir Foundry weapons, Dead Man's Tale and Dead Messenger

// The Showrunner PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Well Rounded, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - Hammer Forged Rifling or Smallbore both work well, and Ricochet Rounds pushes out the range a bit further and adds a bit more stability. There are plenty of ways to proc the gunfeel boosts you get from Well Rounded and, once you've done that you can collect any generated elemental pickups to proc Collective Action which is unusual to see on a Kinetic weapon for a 20% damage boost. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=1999754402&perks=1482024992,1885400500,744594675,3324494224

// The Showrunner PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Well Rounded, Grave Robber, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - Hammer Forged Rifling or Smallbore both work well, and Ricochet Rounds pushes out the range a bit further and adds a bit more stability. For melee-focussed builds, in the first trait column as the support perk, there are plenty of ways to proc the gunfeel boosts you get from Well Rounded or you can use Grave Robber to keep your mag topped up to make the most of Swashbuckler in the second, signature perk slot for 33% bonus damage. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Showrunner PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Ricochet Rounds, Overflow, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for beefier Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The only other current lightweight SMG is Submission which is a stat monster, so Showrunner's stats look a bit poor by comparison, but there are still some interesting PvE rolls worth considering. Lightweights give you +20 Mobility and +6.25% to movement speed as the frame bonus to start. You can push out the range with the barrel perk - Hammer Forged Rifling or Smallbore both work well, and Ricochet Rounds pushes out the range a bit further and adds a bit more stability. In the first trait column, as the support perk, Overflow lets you get to the highest stacks of single-target damage from Target Lock in the second column as the signature perk, for beefier Minor Spec adds. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=1999754402&perks=3250034553,1885400500,3643424744,365154968

// Persuader PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Appened Mag, Extended Mag, Rapid Hit, Triple Tap
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for short phases of sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Even with some decent stats, honestly, there are better rapid-fire sniper options out there for sustained boss damage in a short damage window think Caretaker or Golgoroth, but if you haven't got one of them already, then Persuader can be made to work in the meantime. Start with Arrowhead Brake to control the recoil and boost handling, and add Tactical Mag for 7 shots in the chamber Appended and Extended Mag offer nothing better. The combination of Rapid Hit in the first trait column as the support perk - which adds stability, maximises reload speed together with a reload animation scalar - and Triple Tap in the second column as the signature perk, which lets you get off 10 crit shots without reloading, should provide a decent stopgap. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=781498181&perks=839105230,106909392,247725512,3400784728
dimwishlist:item=781498181&perks=839105230,1087426260,247725512,3400784728
dimwishlist:item=781498181&perks=839105230,2420895100,247725512,3400784728

// Heliocentric QSc PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Alloy Mag, Heal Clip, Frenzy, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content although you'll be brave to be that close!. Heliocentric translation "sun-centred" has great base stats, so you can go for a little extra range, stability or handling with your barrel park - that's pretty much down to your preference. Reload Speed will be the most important magazine perk stat boost, so Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Alloy Mag are good picks. The new to S22 Heal Clip as the first column support perk provides you and any one nearby with a burst of Cure when you reload after a kill. In the second column as the signature perk, Frenzy passively provides maximum Handling and Reload Speed when procced, together with a solid 15% damage boost, or Surrounded gives passive +40% damage for being in CQC. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Heliocentric QSc PvE first-choice roll
// Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Alloy Mag, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Solar synergy and add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content although you'll be brave to be that close!. Heliocentric translation "sun-centred" has great base stats, so you can go for a little extra range, stability or handling with your barrel park - that's pretty much down to your preference. Reload Speed will be the most important magazine perk stat boost, so Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Alloy Mag are good picks. The tried and true combination of Demolitionist in the first trait column as the support park to regenerate grenade energy, and Adrenaline Junkie in the second as the signature perk to use that grenade to boost damage by 33% is always worth considering, if you don't have that combination on a sidearm already, but don't overlook the passive damage and stat boosts from Frenzy and Surrounded either. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait adding range and accuracy on repeated hits isn't game-changing, but it is nice to have. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller

// Geodetic HSm PvE first-choice roll
// Tempered Edge, Hungry Edge, Enduring Blade, Burst Guard, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Geodetic which means relating to the branch of applied mathematics concerned with the size and shape of the Earth is a bit of a curious beast - having +2 Impact compared to other legendary swords excluding Bequest and +27 Charge Rate again, excepting Bequest. If you're looking for an add-clear weapon, you might want to to look at Blade perks that boost your ammo capacity - one hit is likely to kill even in end-game content. Again, you're probably not looking to use the charged attack that frequently, so Burst Guard could be more useful to survive in CQC. This is the first sword that offers the trait combination of Repulsor Brace in the first column as the support perk and Destabilizing Rounds in the second as the signature perk, continuously generating a Void overshield and applying volatility to carve your way through adds. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait boosts lunge distance - a bit like an Eager Edge lite that's permanently up, which could be useful in the Crota's End Abyss encounter. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=938542991,3625355092,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=436053704,3625355092,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=1261178282,3625355092,776531651,2048641572

// Geodetic HSm PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Geodetic which means relating to the branch of applied mathematics concerned with the size and shape of the Earth is a bit of a curious beast - having +2 Impact compared to other legendary swords excluding Bequest and +27 Charge Rate again, excepting Bequest. Even if you have already got a sword decked out for Major or Boss damage, this already starts out doing more damage, so set it up as usual with a damage-boosting blade perk, ideally Jagged Edge, with Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk. Then pair Relentless Strikes to regene4rate ammo one every third strike in the first trait column as the support perk with Whirlwind Blade in the second column as the signature perk to boost damage up up to 30% at 10 stacks. The Nadir Focus Origin Trait boosts lunge distance - a bit like an Eager Edge lite that's permanently up, which could be useful in the Crota's End Abyss encounter. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=3666208348,52780822,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=2827049491,52780822,1749209109,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=3637669759&perks=938542991,52780822,1749209109,3913600130

// Dead Messenger PvE first-choice roll
// Hard Launch, High-Velocity Rounds, The Fundamentals, Short-Action Stock, Unrelenting, Demolitionist
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 78 https://open.spotify.com/episode/5KOQQ9QtvSEhRVb4vjeO3B?si=8c4784e02b87424e with @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Dead Messenger still needs a little love as at v7.2.0.5, even if it does come with a fair few extras built-in. With Blast Radius and Stability being pointless, you might as well maximise Velocity with Hard Launch as the barrel perk, and High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk. Short-Action Stock is the only useful choice as the stock perk, and then as your selectable perk, Unrelenting is good to recover health in a firefight, or Demolitionist should still work even though you only get 10% grenade energy per hit, as with a wave-frame you should catch multiple adds with each shot. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=46125926&perks=981914802,2822142346,1067908860,3108830275,1649663920
dimwishlist:item=46125926&perks=981914802,2822142346,1067908860,3523296417,1649663920

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. You'll appreciate a mix of handling, stability and reload speed from your barrel and mag perks. Fluted Barrel is the obvious top pic for the barrel, but Smallbore is a decent alternative, and then Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell boost the stats you need from the mag. It's always great to see Demolitionist in the first trait column as a support perk for more grenades, and who doesn't love that, and the occasional instant refill when you throw one. In the second trait column as the signature perk, Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing, as is Collective Action from the elemental pickups you can generate from grenades. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
dimwishlist:item=2510526114&perks=1392496348,106909392,3523296417,11612903

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Demolitionist, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. You'll appreciate a mix of handling, stability and reload speed from your barrel and mag perks. Fluted Barrel is the obvious top pic for the barrel, but Smallbore is a decent alternative, and then Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell boost the stats you need from the mag. It's always great to see Demolitionist in the first trait column as a support perk for more grenades, and who doesn't love that, and the occasional instant refill when you throw one, but Enlightened Action or Perpetual Motion are also great for the gunfeel boosts. In the second trait column as the signature perk, Headstone synergises with Stasis subclasses to generate a large crystal to proc fragment perk effects. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Subsistence, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. You'll appreciate a mix of handling, stability and reload speed from your barrel and mag perks. Fluted Barrel is the obvious top pic for the barrel, but Smallbore is a decent alternative, and then Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell boost the stats you need from the mag. For the trait combination, Subsistence as the support perk and Surrounded as the signature perk can work, even in end-game activity - the 40% damage boost from Surrounded should proc the partial mag refill from Subsistence fairly frequently to keep you in the fight for longer. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Unending Tempest PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Collective Action, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear enemies in end-game content. Unending Tempest is probably the best kinetic slot precision SMG, with great stats in comparison to its peers, and with being able to forget about the recoil direction with the frame bonus. But, as it's a Crucible weapon, there is a huge trait pool, so if you do want the best chance of a usable drop, reset your ranks a few times first, before you focus your engrams. You'll appreciate a mix of handling, stability and reload speed from your barrel and mag perks. Fluted Barrel is the obvious top pic for the barrel, but Smallbore is a decent alternative, and then Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell boost the stats you need from the mag. In the first trait column as a support perk, both Enlightened Action and Perpetual Motion boost gunfeel stats, while in the second as the signature perk, Collective Action or Surrounded are both solid damage boosting options. The Nadir Focus origin trait in may be more PvP orientated, but free extra range and accuracy is a nice bonus. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Qua Xaphan V PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhed Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Triple Tap, Clown Cartridge, Target Lock, Frenzy, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. The name literally means "in the character or role of Xaphan" - a fallen angel that rebelled with Satan, and a demon of the second order associated with fire, which doesn't really fit with a void weapon, but there you go. To be honest, if you have a decently rolled void boss-damage LMG, you can ignore Qua Xaphan - it has pretty bad stats. If you are looking for a more easily obtainable one to fill a gap, remember this is a Gambit weapon, so reset your reputation a few times before focusing any engrams. Handling is the usual play for Aggressive LMGs, so Fluted Barrel is the top barrel choice, with Arrowhead Brake and Corkscrew Rifling as decent alternates. Any of the combat effect mag perks Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds or Armor-Piercing Rounds will work, or Flared Magwell is an option to speed up reload speed. As the first trait column support perk, particularly for sustained boss damage, Triple Tap and Clown Cartridge work - Triple Tap can add up to 12 additional shots, and Clown Cartridge between 5 and 22. For additional damage, in the second column support perk, you can hit the higher damage stacks of Target Lock with your overflowed rounds, take a straight 15% damage and maxed handling and reload speed with Frenzy, or 20% additional damage in a fireteam with Firing Line. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Qua Xaphan V PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhed Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Field Prep, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The name literally means "in the character or role of Xaphan" - a fallen angel that rebelled with Satan, and a demon of the second order associated with fire, which doesn't really fit with a void weapon, but there you go. To be honest, if you have a decently rolled void LMG, you can ignore Qua Xaphan - it has pretty bad stats. If you are looking for a more easily obtainable one to fill a gap, remember this is a Gambit weapon, so reset your reputation a few times before focusing any engrams. Handling is the usual play for Aggressive LMGs, so Fluted Barrel is the top barrel choice, with Arrowhead Brake and Corkscrew Rifling as decent alternates. Any of the combat effect mag perks Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds or Armor-Piercing Rounds will work, or Flared Magwell is an option to speed up reload speed. If you want to use this as a heavy scout rifle, for add clear, Field Prep, for the boost to reserves and reload speed is the best option in the first trait column as the support perk, and Destabilizing Rounds gives you access to volatility effects even if you're not using a void subclass, for great add-clearing. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Point of the Stag PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Polymer String, Flexible String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Solid stats by comparison with its Precision Bow peers, and some decent PvE traits mean this is worth focusing a few Iron Banner engrams if you've not already got a decent one. As ever with bows, we're looking to reduce the draw time with the bowstring, so Elastic String is the top choice, with Polymer String and Flexible String being decent alternate choices. Then, to recover the lost accuracy with the arrow perk, choose between Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching. Point of the Stag is the first bow that offers the trait combination of the ever reliable Archer's Tempo as the support perk to speed up draw time, and the new to Season 22 Precision Instrument as the signature perk for an escalating boost to damage - maybe better to use for repeated crits against a single target than for clearing groups of adds. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

Point of the Stag has solid stats by comparison with its Precision Bow peers, and some decent PvE traits mean this is worth focusing a few Iron Banner engrams if you've not already got a decent one. As ever with bows, we're looking to reduce the draw time with the bowstring, so Elastic String is the top choice, with Polymer String and Flexible String being decent alternate choices. Then, to recover the lost accuracy with the arrow perk, choose between Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching. Archer's Tempo is the usual top choice as the support perk to speed up draw time, and Dragonfly as the second trait column signature perk is great for clearing groups of minor adds in general content. // Point of the Stag PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Polymer String, Flexible String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clear and burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Point of the Stag has solid stats by comparison with its Precision Bow peers, and some decent PvE traits mean this is worth focusing a few Iron Banner engrams if you've not already got a decent one. As ever with bows, we're looking to reduce the draw time with the bowstring, so Elastic String is the top choice, with Polymer String and Flexible String being decent alternate choices. Then, to recover the lost accuracy with the arrow perk, choose between Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching. Archer's Tempo is the usual top choice as the support perk to speed up draw time, and Golden Tricorn as the second trait column signature perk give the flexibility of a regular 15% damage boost for 7s after a kill, and a 50% damage boost for 10s with an arc ability kill for burst damage against Majors and Champions. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Guiding Sight PvE first-choice roll#// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Enlightened Action, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for clearing beefier Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The good news is that reprised Guiding Sight is now a Strand Scout Rifle. the bad news is that it's still a high-Impact frame, so it's the least competitive subtype. The stats are decent, so this might be an easier to obtain option, if you've not got a Strand scout already. With the barrel, you can buff some of the low stats - Handling and Stability, and then the mag can help with the reload speed, or just choose from one of the combat effect mags. The pairing of Enlightened Action as the first column support trait to boost Handling and Reload Speed and Precision Instrument in the second column signature perk for an escalating damage buff on crits is a natural pairing to help with long-range add clearing. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Guiding Sight PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for clearing beefier Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The good news is that reprised Guiding Sight is now a Strand Scout Rifle. the bad news is that it's still a high-Impact frame, so it's the least competitive subtype. The stats are decent, so this might be an easier to obtain option, if you've not got a Strand scout already. With the barrel, you can buff some of the low stats - Handling and Stability, and then the mag can help with the reload speed, or just choose from one of the combat effect mags. The pairing of Demolitionist as the first column support trait to regenerate grenade energy and the occasional instant reload and Adrenaline Junkie in the second column signature perk for a refreshable 33% damage buff on a grenade kill is a natural pairing to help with long-range add clearing. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Pre Astyanax IV PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Polymer String, Flexible String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Archer's Tempo, Shoot to Loot, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The literal translation means "Before Astyanax". Astyanax Lord of the City, in Greek legend, is the Trojans' popular nickname for the son of the city's greatest warrior, Prince Hector of Troy, and his wife Andromache. If you haven't got a well-rolled solar Precision bow, this is your chance - the stats are poor, but there are still decent trait combos to chase. If you do, then you can happily pass this by. As ever with bows, we're looking to reduce the draw time with the bowstring, so Elastic String is the top choice, with Polymer String and Flexible String being decent alternate choices. Then, to recover the lost accuracy with the arrow perk, choose between Fiberglass Arrow Shaft or Straight Fletching. Archer's Tempo is the usual reliable choice as the support perk to speed up draw time, but you might also look at Shoot to Loot for picking up ammo bricks remotely in end-game content. In the second trait column as the signature perk, Explosive Head adds a passive boost to damage and adds flinch, and increases the radius for a Shoot to Loot ammo pickup. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Warden's Law PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Tactical Mag, Fourth Time's the Charm, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 77 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4RxkTOwLINWvKzUitNoAFy?si=1426d1f760c544b5 with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr while @CourtProjects is on holiday. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The reprised Warden's Law is the first of a new Heavy Burst subtype, so there's nothing to compare it against. The stats look like those of a 120 but with less range and, although the magazine looks generous, every trigger pull shoots two bullets so in reality, you'll only have 8 shots at base. Handling and Stability could both do with a bump, but we can sort handling with traits, so Polygonal Rifling provides the biggest boost, followed by Smallbore, Fluted Barrel and then Corkscrew Rifling. We can sort reload speed out with a trait too, so you can maximise the rounds with Extended Mag, or play a little safer with Appended Mag or Tactical Mag. In the first trait column as the support perk, the most useful option is Fourth Time's the Charm, and then Frenzy as the second column signature perk maximises handling and reload speed along with the useful 15% buff to damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec, or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Igneous Hammer PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Heal Clip, Frenzy

First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Igneous Hammer is back, with the best stats of any Aggressive Hand Cannons in the game as at v7.2.0.3, and a new and very chasable trait pairing. Handling and Stability could both do with a bump, but we can sort handling with traits, so Polygonal Rifling provides the biggest boost in the barrel, followed by Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel and then Corkscrew Rifling. We can sort reload speed out with a trait too, so you can choose any of the combat effect rounds as your mag perk. In the first trait column as the support perk, the new combination worth chasing is Heal Clip, for the Cure for yourself and nearby fireteam on reloads after a kill, and then Frenzy as the second column signature perk to maximise handling and reload speed along with the useful 15% buff to damage. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec, or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, mkb, controller
