@title:Season 20 Guardian Games weapons
@description:Lightfall Guardian Games weapons with Classy Contender origin trait

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons . Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,4071163871,3708227201

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for void synergy minor add clear in general activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons . Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong. For void synergy, in the second column signature perk slot, Repulsor Brace provides a void overshield on void debuffed enemy kills - very useful for keeping you alive in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3559361670&perks=202670084,1885400500,4071163871,776531651

// The Title PvE first-choice roll
// Full Bore, Ricochet Rounds, Threat Detector, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for minor add clear in general activities for melee builds. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons . If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. Full Bore and Ricochet Rounds add a few metres of useful range. Then, the tried and true combination of Pugilist in the first trait column as the support perk and Swashbuckler in the second as the signature perk is great for melee builds. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Taraxippos PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Fourth Time's The Charm, Outlaw, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

dimwishlist:item=1389546626&perks=839105230,3230963543,1354429876,831391274

@title:Root of Nightmares weapons

// Rufus's Fury PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. Flared Magwell or Ricochet Rounds add Stability and Reload Speed or Range and Stability in the magazine. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Acasia's Dejection PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Particle Repeater, Field Prep, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. You can use this as a pseudo primary weapon with Field Prep as your first trait column support perk boosting your reserves, and Frenzy as your second column signature perk not only boosting damage by 15%, but capping out Handling and Reload Speed at 100. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range or Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

For use against crowds of adds, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Incandescent's scorch and ignition solar-subclass verbs for crowd control as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Acasia's Dejection Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Light Battery, Tactical Battery, Particle Repeater, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Solar subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Acasia's Dejection is no different - this is the best legendary trace rifle as at v7.0.0.6. The recoil is already pretty easy to control with 96 Recoil Direction and 80 stability, so your barrel and battery choices are more of a bonus than gap filler. For use against crowds of adds, an overflowed or refilled magazine is a great place to start, so Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds as your first trait column support perk both give you greater uptime for Incandescent's scorch and ignition solar-subclass verbs for crowd control as the second column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Koraxis's Distress PvE first-choice roll
// Linear Compensator, Quick Launch, Spike Grenades, Chain Reactions, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, Linear Compensator adds a little extra Blast Radius let's face it, you'll want to catch as many adds as possible in an explosion, or Quick Launch just goes all in for velocity in the barrel. If you do catch a chunkier enemy, Spike Grenades is nice for a little extra impact damage, and then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Velocity - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=1441682018,3301904089,2396489472,831391274
dimwishlist:item=2972949637&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2396489472,831391274

// Koraxis's Distress PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, High-Explosive Ordnance, Chain Reaction, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for Strand subclass synergy for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast excellent stat packages, and Koraxis's Distress is no different. Rapid fire power grenade launchers are more suited to add clear, so to lean into that role, you'll want the Blast Radius as large as possible - Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordnance add 25 and a masterwork adds another 10. Then the unique combination of Chain Reaction as your first trait column support perk - let's face it, it's unusual to have it as a support perk - and Hatchling as the signature perk in the second trait column. Chain Reaction kills count towards proccing Hatchling, so you should see plenty of Threadlings spawning. Explosions and a small army of Threadlings together should clear a room pretty fast. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Briar's Contempt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Enhanced Battery, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Focused Fury 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine to keep get as many shots with Focused Fury's damage boost as possible, as your second trait column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Briar's Contempt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Enhanced Battery, Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Demolitionist, Frenzy 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by up to 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine, or alternatively Demolitionist provides an instant reload to keep damage uptime for Frenzy's 15% damage boost as your second trait column signature perk. The additional 50 Reload Speed from Frenzy is handy, once you do need to reload, too. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Briar's Contempt PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Enhanced Battery, Incandescent, Paracausal Affinity 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10% so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. Unusually, you can roll Incandescent in the first trait column as your support perk, to synergise with solar subclasses to improve scorch and ignition, and proc Paracausal Affinity in the second column as your signature park. Paracausal Affinity then buffs ignition damage to keep the loop going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Battle Scar PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds, Perpetual Motion, Keep Away, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles as at v7.0.0.7, anyway but they add a very useful +20 mobility useful when buildcrafting and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!. You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. To improve your gunfeel, in the first trait slot as you r support perk, Perpetual Motion adds a decent bump to handling, stability and reload speed, or if you want extra range then Keep Away boosts that, reload speed and accuracy. Osmosis, as your signature perk in the second trait column is fairly rare and will pick up any of the energy synergies from your subclass say, volatile rounds when that's procced by a void ability - if you haven't already got a pulse rifle with the perk, then this would be worth hanging on to. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preferece, with a damage-boosting Minor, Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,106909392,1428297954,1774574192
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,3142289711,1428297954,1774574192
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,106909392,3619207468,1774574192
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=839105230,3142289711,3619207468,1774574192

// Harsh Language PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Destabilizing Rounds, Repulsor Brace
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and Minor add clear in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper although the range of stats is pretty compressed - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. the standout support perk in the first trait column is Envious Assassin - you can get up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon. You have a choice of two signature perks in the second trait column to help with add clear - Destabilising Rounds is the more offensive option for add clear or Repulsor Brace for tanking damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3525010810,2822142346,968510818,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=3798852852,2822142346,968510818,2048641572

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Feeding Frenzy, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while Headstone as your signature perk in the second trait column generates your Stasis crystal on a crit kill to use your subclass fragments with. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1087426260,2779035018,124408337
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,3230963543,2779035018,124408337
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,679225683,2779035018,124408337

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Feeding Frenzy, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, Flared Magwell or maybe Appended Mag are probably the best picks - Light Mag isn't bad either. Feeding Frenzy as your support perk in the first trait column will speed up reloads still further after kills, while the first stack of Golden Tricorn as your signature perk in the second trait column is a reliable 15% damage boost, even if the second stack is tougher to proc with Stasis abilities. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec oe Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Senuna SI6 PvE first-choice roll
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Season 20 Omolon weapon named after Celtic godess worshipped in Roman Britain, if you're asking is an Adaptive Stasis Sidearm. First thing to say is that, if you already have a decent stasis sidearm, this really doesn't offer anything much new so you can probably give it a miss. For newer Guardians, controlling the recoil on sidearms, through recoil direction and stability, is the job of your barrel and mag although additional reload speed for the Senuna is also useful. If you're a serial reloaded, the Omolon origin trait will help with both in the top half of the magazine. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk brings the Recoil Direction to 100 and adds handling to make the gun feel snappier. In the mag, you can take your pick of any combat effect perk - High-Caliber, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds. Grave Robber as your support perk in the first trait column bypasses reloads just for melee kills on adds and, if that's what you're doing, Pugilist synergises well as your signature perk in the second trait column, by returning melee energy on kills. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=5159537&perks=839105230,1561002382,1631667848,691659142

// Irukandji PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Steady Rounds, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Envious Assassing, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit, Firing Line, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in a fireteam in end-game content. The Season 20 Veist weapon is a rapid-fire sniper rifle with as-expected lowish stats, as a World drop weapon. Irukandji a small, rare, highly venomous jellyfish from Australia, because of course it would be does benefit from the Veist Stinger origin trait which is occasionally useful even in its nerfed state. Remember that as at Season 20, this will do less base damage than an equivalent kinetic weapon so, to be competitive, you'll need the parks to fall your way. The main issue you'll find is with keeping the reticule on a boss's crit spot - you'll need to boost Recoil Direction and Stability to make this easier, so Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling are your barrel perk choices, and Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Steady Rounds you're not likely to be outside of the damage falloff distance, even with the range penalty should be your mag perk options. As your first trait column support perk, Envious Assassin overflows your magazine passively with primary and power weapon kills, Fourth Time's The Charm works extends the magazine if you hit crits consistently, or Rapid Hit improves stability and reload speed as you fire to keep your reticule steadier. In the signature perk, second column trait, Firing Line is more forgiving of an occasional missed shot when you're in a fireteam but, if you're flying solo, Focused Fury will boost damage in the bottom half of your magazine if you can hit your crits consistently. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Marsilion-C PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Augmented Drum, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking, a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control. With 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will be much less effective, so Augmented Drum is the better mag perk, as this synergises with Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column, for more ammo reserves and faster reloads. The Enhanced Explosive Light perk grants an extra stack of damage over the standard version, so you'll have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3525010810,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=867154247&perks=3798852852,1771897777,2869569095,3194351027

@title:Season of Defiance weapons
@description:Season 20 weapons wit the Noble Deeds origin trait

// Perpetualis PvE first-choice roll
// Extended Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Keep Away, Zen Moment, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling and boost reload speed too. Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, Golden Tricorn is unique as at v7.0.0.6, anyway on a Strand auto rifle and the second stack isn't too difficult to proc by either using a grapple melee or shooting a Tangle, for a massive 50% damage boost for 10s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=392008588&perks=1467527085,106909392,3619207468,2610012052

// Raconteur PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Compact Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for end-game activities. Shapeable. Our first Stasis Precision Bow, with competitive stats by comparison with the other kinetic slot options, although Accuracy is the lowest of all the Precisions. Your aim with the Bowstring and Arrow, as ever, is to reduce the draw time, while not harming your accuracy or handling. Elastic String is the best for as low a draw time as possible and helps Handling too, at the cost of Accuracy, which you can recover with an Accuracy Masterwork, while Compact Arrow Shaft boosts handling and reload speed. Don't forget, the Noble Deeds origin perk will also boost both as well. If you ever see Archer's Tempo as the support perk in the first trait column then you don't need to look much further. Similarly, Explosive Head adds damage and flinch for free so is the best signature perk in the second trait column. Recommended MW: Accuracy or Draw Time, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=45643573&perks=2801223209,16392701,201365942,3365897133

// Royal Executioner PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Threat Detector, Lead from Gold, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Solar synergy in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is a stand out support perk in the first trait column, overflowing the magazine as you get primary and power weapon kills, but Threat Detector and Lead From Gold are right up there too. This is the first solar FR to give the option of Incandescent as the signature perk in the second column, which plays into the subclass verbs for end-game add clear. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,968510818,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,4071163871,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=1720503118&perks=839105230,689005463,1556840489,4293542123

// Prodigal Return PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Disorienting Grenades, Envious Assassin, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add suppression in end-game activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. For add control, Disorienting Grenades give you breathing space in a firefight. Pair that with Envious Assassin, which can give you up to three in the barrel! as your support perk in the first trait column, and Disruption Break, for 50% bonus kinetic damage to burst down chunkier red bar Minors and the occasional Major while they stumble around as the signature perk, and you probably have the perfect add control breach-loading GL. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling for faster swaps or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=268260373&perks=3525010810,3032599245,968510818,1683379515

// Prodigal Return PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Threadt Detector, Field Prep, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for Arc Synergy in general activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling and Reload Speed, so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. With one eye towards building a weapon around Voltshot this is the first GL with Voltshot as an option, although the jury is still out on whether that's a good idea or not as the signature perk in the second trait column, we'll need to make the reload as fast as possible. High Velocity Rounds boosts reload speed as well as velocity. Then Threat Detector or Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column helps too. Using Spark of Beacons gives you arc Blinding on a kill, which should make the follow-up shot after a kill, to get your Jolt damage tick, easier to hit. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your pick of the support perks, Auto-Loading Holster lets you empty the magazine and reload while you're swapped to your DPS special weapon to rinse and repeat, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst DPS against majors in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your support perk, Envious Assassin overflows the magazine or the most quick shots to finish off a major or stunned Champion quickly, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-major, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Regnant PvE first-choice roll
// Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator, High-Explosive Ordnance, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. You'll be using this roll for add clearing, so you'll want to crank up the blast radius with your barrel with Volatile Launch, High Explosive Ordnance in the magazine, and a Blast Radious Masterwork. Repulsor Brace as your support perk in the first trait column gives you a void overshield for void-debuffed kills, which is exactly what Destabilizing Rounds sets you up for, as your signature perk in the second trait column, making targets near a kill volatile, including chunkier ones for easier clean-up with the next shot. This combination should make you a bit of a walking tank in add-dense areas, as long as you have ammo. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=1478423395,1380253176,776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=268260372&perks=1441682018,1380253176,776531651,2048641572

// Caretaker PvE first-choice roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and minor add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 except DSC's Bequest, and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support perk in the first trait column, both Tireless Blade and Relentless Strikes work but, once you get Incandescent working and Ember of Ashes helps as your signature perk in the second trait column, the ignite kills among adds count towards Tireless Blade kills, so that will be the more efficient way to regain ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,2590710093,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2508948099&perks=3666208348,269888150,1749209109,4293542123

// Synchronic Roulette PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Pulse Monitor, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Precision frame SMG, so you don't have to worry about recoil direction and range is pretty compressed, so go for handling and stability with your barrel. In the mag, High-Caliber Rounds is always good for extra flinch on a bullet hose, but Armor-Piercing is also decent for damaging multiple adds in CQC, Ricochet Rounds can be run or just get extra stability and Reload speed with Flared Magwell. There's not much PvE-wise in the first trait column but Pulse Monitor could be useful if you're out of cover to use Target Lock and are taking damage, to reload you magazine to keep your damage output up, and the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=811403305&perks=1840239774,1561002382,972757866,365154968

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - maybe not the play for end-game activities where you're probably in trouble if you're close enough to use it, but useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Destabilizing Rounds spreads volatility to surrounding adds on a kill to synergise with Void subclass verbs. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Trench Barrel is reliable for fast burst damage in CQC and works well on a rapid-fire frame. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Grave Robber, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage for Lethal Current/Liar's Handshake Hunters. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. You should be getting melee kills as you're rolling around and punching so Grave Robber should keep your mag filled, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage even if it's been nerfed somewhat. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=1047830412,106909392,1631667848,2679249093

// Basso Ostinato PvE first-choice roll
// Full Choke, Tactical Mag, Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion, One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. With one eye on One-Two Punch in the second trait column, Full Choke gives you the best chance of hitting your target with every pellet, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too, and One-Two Punch adds additional multiplicative melee damage even if it's been nerfed somewhat to burst down a major, or even a boss. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Iterative Loop PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils, Compulsive Reloader, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for Arc synergy and burst damage. Seeing as fusion rifles apply the highest Jolt tick damage of any special weapon, it would be rude not to pick or shape a roll. Rapid fire fusions need a fair bit of control with nine bolts being fired, so Arrowhead Break takes the recoil direction to 77, or up the stability through Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. In the battery, there's nothing to help speed up reloading, so Particle Repeater adds more stability, or Accelerated Coils speeds up charge time. Compulsive Reloader and a Reload Speed Masterwork boosts reload to 100 at the top half of the mag, so your reloads after a kill to proc Voltshot should be as snappy as it's possible to get. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with rapid kills - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Volta Bracket PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Envious Assassin, Explosive Payload, Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Sniper rifles are in a bit of a tough spot as v7.0.0.3, but it's worth holding on to a good roll or two in the Vault, just in case. If you're shaping one, Fluted Barrel makes it snappier, and you can bypass the reload speed penalty of Extended Barrel with Backup Mag and Envious Assassin, to overload your magazine of 5 to 8. In the second trait column, Explosive Payload adds a flat 15% bonus damage or, in a fireteam, Firing Line adds 20% crit damage. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Aurvandil FR6 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Stats For All, One For All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. If you spray with your first shot, then the SOFA Stats/One For All roll will more than offset any reload penalty, along with other gunfeel boosts, as well as increasing damage by a chunky 35%. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a touch of extra stability too. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability, Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-major, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Aurvandil FR6 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reconstruction, Subsistence, Slideways, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. Reconstruction, Subsistence or Slideways all help you keep your magazine topped up so you can take advantage of the damage boost from Golden Tricorn. With this being a stasis weapon, the second stack is tough to proc, but the 15% extra damage from one stack is reliable and refreshable. The Omolon origin trait is useful in the top half of the mag, to help with reloads and a bit of extra stability too. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability, Reload Speed or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Fioritura-59 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Pugilist, Repulsor Brace
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time, or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee to add a void verb to your target to proc Repulsor Brace on a kill and generate a void overshield to help tank damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Jararaca-3sr PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for stasis subclasses in end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. First, ou'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help reloads, so you can live without a reload speed-boosting magazine perk, especially with Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion in the first trait column. Finally, for Stasis synergy, in the second trait column Headstone's crystals work with your aspects and fragments. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Jararaca-3sr PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Fourth Time's the Charm, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. First, you'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help with reloads. A combination of Fourth Time's the Charm to extend the mag together with Focused Fury, to add 20% bonus damage for hitting nine crits assuming a mag size of 17 until you reload again should serve you well in end-game activities. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Lodbrok-C PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Extended Mag, Appended Mag, Fourth Time's The Charm, Target Lock
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. To take full advantage of Target Lock, to burst down beefier minors, look for as large a magazine as you can and combine with Fourth Time's the Charm. This could be a little niche, but this roll with Lodbrok could be a useful tool to have in your loadout if you're facing constructs and vehicles, with the Hakke Breach Armaments' 15% damage boost on top of Target Lock. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Lodbrok-C PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Osmosis, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. Any of the combat effect magazines can help you - High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds - so that's down to your preference. Even though match game is less of an issue from Season 20, you can take advantage of any ability verbs from the grenade you throw - so, for example, a void grenade can proc Volatile Rounds which your now void energy Lodbrok will apply. Unfortunately Demolitionist rolls in the same trait column, but Adrenaline Junkie will trigger on a grenade kill for 33% boost to damage on top in the second column instead. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Lodbrok-C PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Demolitionist, Adrenaline Junkie
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Pretty decent, in-bands stats, so Smallbore offers a little extra range and stability, both of which are useful boosts. Any of the combat effect magazines can help you - High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing or Ricochet Rounds - so that's down to your preference. Demolitionist with Adrenaline Junkie is a natural pairing - get the grenade kill to proc 33% extra damage and then clean up to regenerate your grenade energy to keep the loop going. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Tripwire Canary PvE first-choice roll
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Frenzy, Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. In the second column, damage boosts from Frenzy, just for being in combat, or Swashbuckler with your choice of 3.0 melee options both improve utility. MW: Draw Time or Accuracy, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3849444474&perks=2801223209,3429800428,201365942,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=3849444474&perks=2801223209,3429800428,201365942,4082225868

// Path of Least Resistance PvE first-choice roll
Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Particle Repeater, Tactical Battery, Light Battery, Enhanced Battery, Adaptive Munitions, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or Omolon Fluid Dynamics' extra stability and reload speed is always welcome. An arc legendary trace rifle to complete the energy set. Stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but there are a few interesting rolls, and at least now you can collect them all! Perhaps worth tucking away for the day that we get an anti-Barrier mod. Keep the beam on target with a stability barrel, , together with a battery that provides some extra stability, reload speed, range or charge. With Trace Rifle's fire rate, this should rip through non-matching shields in match game, and Focused Fury can then help take the Champion down once stunned. MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, pve-god, controller, mkb

// Judgment of Kelgorath PvE first-choice roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, Overflow, Close to Melee
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Close to Melee was just built for glaives - projectile kills improve melee damage by 30%, and more kills with either projectile or melee extend the timer. Proc and go have fun. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-god, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2978226043&perks=580685494,1087426260,3643424744,1782407750

// Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Tactical Mag adds a few extra shots, plus stability and reload speed. Rapid-fires have plenty of rounds to proc the SOFA Stats/One for All trait combination. Bonus handling, stability, range and reload speed, plus a 35% boost to damage just for hitting three different enemies. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag or damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=3103325054&perks=839105230,106909392,1583705720,4049631843

This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or boost stability with your barrel perk. Add your choice of extra shots, stability and reload speed with the mag. Rapid-fires have plenty of rounds to proc the SOFA Stats/One for All trait combination. Bonus handling, stability, range and reload speed, plus a 35% boost to damage just for hitting three different enemies. // Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Stats for All, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm, Feeding Frenzy, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Tactical Mag adds a few extra shots, plus stability and reload speed. To lean into the Void 3.0 sandbox, give yourself as much ammo and uptime in the first trait column with Stats for All, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm or Feeding Frenzy to take advantage of Golden Tricorn's 50% bonus damage with two stacks, using your choice of void grenade or melee. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Retrofit Escapade PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, Stats for All, Field Prep, Feeding Frenzy, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or boost stability with your barrel perk. Add your choice of extra shots, stability and reload speed with the mag. For end-game add clear, use Stats for All, Field Prep, or Feeding Frenzy for maximum uptime in your first trait column, and the reliable Frenzy in the second for an easy to use 15% damage boost. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Fire and Forget PvE first-choice roll
Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Enhanced Battery, Field Prep, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game boss DPS. Shapeable. Veist Stinger is the origin trait to use, as it procs per shot rather than per burst, which means you'll probably never need to reload. F&F is a non-endgame obtainable  boss-killing replacement for Reed's Regret, and a aggressive-frame companion to Stormchaser. Being a stasis LFR, it's easy to get a Font of Might 25% boost to your damage if you have a Warlock putting down a Well and willing to use the Supreme Wellmaker mod, and you're using the Elemental Shards and Elemental Time Dilation mods. You'll need to keep your shots on a boss's crit spot, so maximise your stability with your barrel, and then add in an extra charge with no downsides with Enhanced Battery. For boss damage, use Field Prep to boost your ammo reserves which you'll be calling on with Veist Stinger, and you'll get plenty of opportunity to proc the 20% damage boost from Focused Fury once you hit six individual crits the trait procs on individual shots rather than on bursts. Recommended  MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,2896038713
dimwishlist:item=2272041093&perks=1392496348,2680121939,2869569095,2896038713

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Seraph Rounds, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Precisions aren't the strongest choice for PvE as at Season 19 v6.3.0.2, and the Ikelos HC's stats are pretty bad across the board, but there are a few combinations that are still interesting. Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. Even though you're using about 25% of your magazine to proc SOFA Stats/One for All, the stat boosts to round everything out and 35% damage boost are well worth it for add-clear. Recommended  MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
dimwishlist:item=1731355324&perks=1840239774,1140096971,1583705720,4049631843

// Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Seraph Rounds, Stats for All, Rapid Hit, Triple Tap, Well Rounded, Triple Tap, Rapid Hit, Stats for All, Golden Tricorn

Precisions aren't the strongest choice for PvE as at Season 19 v6.3.0.2, and the Ikelos HC's stats are pretty bad across the board, but there are a few combinations that are still interesting. Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. To make the most of your Void 3.0 toolkit, use Golden Tricorn in the second column to get a 50% damage boost at two stacks one stack is not bad - it's still as good a Frenzy. Back in the first column, Well Rounded provides stat boosts as you gain the second GT stack, or any of the other magazine extending/reload speed boosting traits keep you firing. Recommended  MW: Range or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Seraph Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general add clear. Shapeable. Voltshot SMG anyone? It's already an S-Tier stat monster, but is anyone actually reading past the word Voltshot? The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. To pair with Voltshot, forget Feeding Frenzy as it doesn't pair well so, instead, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit. Recommended  MW: Reload or Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general add clear. Shapeable. Voltshot SMG anyone? It's already an S-Tier stat monster, but is anyone actually reading past the word Voltshot? The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then to help with Voltshot you want your reload to be as fast as possible - Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both help out. To pair with Voltshot, forget Feeding Frenzy as it doesn't pair well so, instead, Threat Detector  will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit. // IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Seraph Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. It's already an S-Tier stat monster and the Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. If you're looking at end-game add-clearing, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% and the enhanced version by 47%. But, even though this is a great roll, you'll still know in your heart that you really wanted Voltshot... Recommended  MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-god, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

title:Season 19 Dawning weapons
description:New and reprised Dawning weapons with the Dawning Surprise origin perk

// Cold Front PvE first-choice roll
// Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Stats for All, One for All
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for end-game Minor clearing. The only easily available Aggressive SMG in the game other than Xur selling an Extraordinary Rendition - you have a good one, you probably won't need a Cold Front. Option of Hakke Breach Armaments or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. Very poor stability, so for controller Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel or Smallbore is a must, together with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell to get it as high as possible. For end-game add clear, the reliable SOFA combination of Stats for All and One for All rounds out the stats and adds 35% bonus damage just for hitting three different enemies. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-god, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb
