// Dragoncult Sickle PvE backup roll
// Honed Edge, Tempered Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Slice, Surrounded, Whirlwind Blade
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 90 https://open.spotify.com/episode/7C3Wx7xXVw10WshiLn5sT8?si=ZNEiHi_ZRfW5z3BbkOMrVQ with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways, and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies particularly for Strand subclasses in end-game content. This is the first new Caster-Frame sword we've seen in some time, and the first Strand one. Dungeon weapons tend to have better stats than world drops, and Dragoncult Sickle is no exception, having pretty good overall stats - both Impact and Ammo Capacity are higher than its peers. The advantage you have with caster frames is that you can hit from range with the heavy attack, but the ammo cost as at v7.3.0.3 is still a little high. On the other hand, you can use it for major or boss damage - the standard Impact-boosting blade for the extra damage and Swordmaster's Guard for the Guard perk still apply. The new-to-Season-23 Slice as the first trait perk gives this an ability to sever a major or a boss, reducing its outgoing damage by 40% for 10s or 15s with Thread of Continuity, which can be a lifesaver in a CQC fight. In the second trait column as the signature perk, you could go for Surrounded, if you know there will be adds around to boost damage by 40%, or Whirlwind Blade if there aren't. The origin trait is situationally useful if you're in a construct-heavy environment, like the Warlord's Ruin dungeon itself. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

dimwishlist:item=3668817296&perks=938542991,269888150,923806249,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3668817296&perks=3666208348,269888150,923806249,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=3668817296&perks=938542991,269888150,923806249,3708227201

// Cold Comfort PvE first-choice roll
// Quick Launch, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light, Bait and Switch, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors and Bosses in end-game activities. Cold Comfort has decent stats, including ammo reserves so you can get to 10 host with three reserve mods. This could be a sleeper pick for burst damage against Major enemies, and against boss enemies with short damage windows. Aggressives are the fastest-firing subfamily, in the group with the highest damage per shot. Quick Launch is the usual play for the barrel, to improve velocity. For as high a damage output as possible, Impact Casing boosts overall damage by 2.2% doesn't sound much but remember, any mutilplicative damage starts adding up. Envious Assassin, in the first trait slot as the support perk, can get you 3 in the mag from six rapid kills - let's just say they just all fit in the barrel paracausally - and if you have the Restoration Ritual origin trait procced, that'll be four shots without reloading. Bait and Switch provides the highest damage boost - 35% when procced, but needs some setup, or Explosive Light is a 25% damage boost just for picking up some orbs. As a left-field pick though, don't throw away a bipod roll - it'll only take a small change to the perk to make it extremely competitive, doubling the barrel capacity and adding 5 to your reserves. That could mean seven shots without reloading, if you include the origin trait... Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

dimwishlist:item=839786290&perks=3525010810,3525010810,968510818,1439600632

// A Distant Pull PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Explosive Payload, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. If you can reliably hit crits, you can get 10 shots off without reloading with Triple Tap as a first trait column support park. As a second column signature perk, Explosive Payload or Collective Action both add additional damage for burst DPS against Majors, and the occasional sustained damage phase against a boss. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss, or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// A Distant Pull PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Triple Tap, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for sustained damage against Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. As at S21, A Distant Pull is the only non-raid kinetic rapid-fire sniper rifle. As you might expect, it comes with lower stats but it's still usable if you can fill the gaps. Fluted Barrel and Tactical Mag fill out Handling, Stability, Reload Speed and also max out the magazine size to 7. If you can reliably hit crits, you can get 10 shots off without reloading with Triple Tap as a first trait column support park. As a second column signature perk, Focused Fury procs after three crits, giving you 7 shots with a 20% boost to damage for a sustained damage phase against a boss. // Taraxippos PvE backup roll
// Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Zen Moment, Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. If you're still finding the recoil difficult, you can proc all 5 stacks of Zen Moment with just three hits, in the first trait column as your support perk. If you're not finding it a problem, than Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk adds 30% damage with no falloff, and is useful when Scouts are the seasonal anti-Overload Champion mod, only needing two shots to disrupt. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-champion, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Appended Mag, Demolitionist, Paracausal Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Light subclass synergy against Majors in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still deal decent damage when the occasion demands. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Appended Mag adds a shot, which is always a good thing, as your magazine perk. As your first trait column support perk, Demolitionist means grenades remember, it's 20% grenade energy for special weapon kills, which means you should have an easy way to proc Paracausal Affinity for 20% bonus damage for 6s to clear beefier Minors, and Majors. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Nessa's Oblation PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Appended Mag, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Void subclass synergy in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still be effective to control beefier minors, and majors. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Appended Mag adds a shot, which is always a good thing, as your magazine perk. It's unusual to be able to roll two Void perks, so the opportunity to roll Repulsor Brace in the first trait column as your support perk, for damage reduction void overshields, and Destabilizing Rounds as your signature perk in the second to spread volatility on a kill is difficult to pass up. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. // Nessa's Oblation Adept PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Appended Mag, FRepulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Void subclass synergy in end-game content. While slug shotguns aren't the burst damage meta they once were, they can still be effective to control beefier minors, and majors. For the barrel, stability is a bit more important than normal, to keep your reticule on target, but Handling is still useful too. Appended Mag adds a shot, which is always a good thing, as your magazine perk.  It's unusual to be able to roll two Void perks, so the opportunity to roll Repulsor Brace in the first trait column as your support perk, for damage reduction void overshields, and Destabilizing Rounds as your signature perk in the second to spread volatility on a kill is difficult to pass up. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

Pump up stability as high as it will go to keep your shots on target. // Judgment of Kelgorath PvE backup roll
// Auxilliary Reserves, Low Impedence Windings, Appended Mag, Light Mag, Overflow, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed governed by range isn't quite as important, and the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it, or the faster reload and extra range from Light Mag. In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick! Pair that with the newly buffed Surrounded for a ridiculous 40% 47% for the Enhanced version bonus to projectile damage for just for being near three enemies. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten things up with additional stability. For damage against a single target, you want your magazine as large as it will go, so look for Extended or Appended. Then extend the magazine with Fourth Time's the Charm, or improve your ammo reserves and reload with Field Prep in the first trait column to give Target Lock's 40& bonus to damage as much uptime as possible. // Mechabre PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Clown Cartridge, Vorpal Weapon, High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE backup roll for burst damage against Majors. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look to boost Handling with the barrel. It's difficult to get to five in the mag to make Triple Tap proc twice, so go for Appended Mag instead to add an extra round. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge boosts magazine size by a shot or two on reload, and in the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles or High-Impact Reserves will add up to 25% bonus damage once you get past the second bullet. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Spec damage as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. You're looking for Hard Launch ideally, but any barrel that boosts handling still works, to speed up swap speed. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Auto-Loading Holster just works - reloading in your pocket while you're doing dame with your heavy. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but if you're firing eight or more shots over the course of a longer damage phase, you'll get more bonus damage from Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. //notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance. The stats are worse - it's not an end-game weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed ut a bit too. For the first trait perk Left From Gold or Demolitionist are both solid choices, while to boost damage in the second trait column One for All or Adrenaline Junkie should both help deal with bulkier adds. // Waking Vigil PvE first-choice roll
// Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Subsistence, Kinetic Tremors, Attrition Orbs, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Dragonfly
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content. As a former Lightweight HC that's been crowbarred into the Adaptive subfamily, the stats look very weird, with low range and stability but high handling and reload speed. If you haven't already got a decent arc hand cannon, then you could push out the range a bit, even at the cost of a little Handling, and add a little Stability. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. Rapid Hit is the best support perk choice in the first column traits, although Perpetual Motion isn't bad either. Dragonfly in the second trait column as the signature perk is great for thinning out add crowds when you're hitting crits. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// Brya's Love PvE backup roll
Fluted Barrel, Smnallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion, Explosive Payload, Frenzy, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 76 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4UoXFYD3DbunDEKIGDiriX?si=1957400d9e024ed5 with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for Minor Spec enemies in end-game content - only keep if you don't have an existing well-rolled void scout rifle. Shapeable. Brya's Love - named after Eris's Ghost - is up against Doom of Chelchis as a void precision frame scout rifle so, as you'd expect, doesn't fare well in a straight stat comparison. There are still some useful and unique trait combinations available to craft. For the barrel perk, Fluted Barrel or Smallbore are probably your top two choices - as a precision frame, the recoil direction stat doesn't really matter - or you could opt to go all into Stability with Polygonal Rifling or range with Hammer-Forged Rifling. For the magazine perk, Tactical Mag is the best choice, or possibly Appended mag of one more shot. As your support trait, Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion both add decent gunfeel boosts, while Explosive Payload, Frenzy or Golden Tricorn all work in end-game activities to boost damage. Whether you find the Head Rush origin trait useful will depend on how often you crouch and get up again - if you do, the additional handling and reload speed is useful, if not game-changing. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Eremite PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Enhanced Battery, Cure Clip, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 76 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4UoXFYD3DbunDEKIGDiriX?si=1957400d9e024ed5 with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for support builds in end-game content. Shapeable. The Eremite named after a religious recluse, being the root for the word hermit, is a bit of a season 21 banger! Although the stats are below average, this should be on your list of weapons you aim to farm and craft. Fluted Barrel as the barrel perk bumps up handling and adds a dash of stability, and Enhanced Battery adds an additional shot. For support builds in end-game content, the new to season 21 Cure Clip as the support perk in the first trait slot, provides group healing on a reload after a kill - in the second, signature perk, trait slot Reservoir Burst adds 25% burst damage when the battery's full, adds the fun explosions, and needs a reload afterwards anyway to get it ready for next time, so works well as a combination. Whether you find the Head Rush origin trait useful will depend on how often you crouch and get up again - if you do, the additional handling and reload speed is useful, if not game-changing. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// New Pacific Epitaph PvE backup roll
// Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control, High-Velocity Rounds, Demolitionist, Lead From Gold, Unrelenting, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. New Pacific Epitaph is the first kinetic slot wave frame grenade launcher, so there's no direct comparison, but compared to the energy slot versions the stats are decent. As ever, play is to get the shot speed as high as you can, so Quick Launch in the barrel and High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine are the best choices. For use against endgame minor adds, as the first trait column support perk Demolitionist which returns 20% grenade energy on special weapons, and allows for an instant reload on a grenade throw, or Lead from Gold for ammo economy, or Unrelenting to help you stay alive all work well. In the second column as the signature Perk, Collective Action should be easy to proc with all the Elemental Pickups now available, for a 20% damage boost for 7s. The Restoration Ritual origin trait is also occasionally useful for an instant reload after proccing. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Cold Comfort PvE backup roll
// Hard Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control, Impact Casing, Envious Assassin, Explosive Light, Bait and Switch, Bipod
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 67 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3wGaXiUGMNodLkPkGFdBd3?si=42e0db2e63a443b7 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE pick for burst damage against Majors and Bosses in end-game activities. Cold Comfort has decent stats, including ammo reserves so you can get to 10 host with three reserve mods. This could be a sleeper pick for burst damage against Major enemies, and against boss enemies with short damage windows. Aggressives are the fastest-firing subfamily, in the group with the highest damage per shot. First, a velocity-boosting perk is the usual play for the barrel. Impact Casing boosts overall damage by 2.2% doesn't sound much but remember, any mutilplicative damage starts adding up. Envious Assassin, in the first trait slot as the support perk, can get you 3 in the mag from six rapid kills - let's just say they just all fit in the barrel paracausally - and if you have the Restoration Ritual origin trait procced, that'll be four shots without reloading. Bait and Switch provides the highest damage boost - 35% when procced, but needs some setup, or Explosive Light is a 25% damage boost just for picking up some orbs. As a left-field pick though, don't throw away a bipod roll - it'll only take a small change to the perk to make it extremely competitive, doubling the barrel capacity and adding 5 to your reserves. That could mean seven shots without reloading, if you include the origin trait... Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting Major, Boss or Taken Spec. tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-major, controller, mkb

// Thin Precipice PvE backup roll
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Collective Action
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/4XT0gPkoVSh3cM6gMtSupq?si=18db495353ca49ad with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. Backup PvE pick for burst damage to Majors in end-game content. Shapeable. Thin Precipice is the first Strand sword, and is the fan-favourite vortex spin-to-win frame to boot. As with all swords, Jagged Edge is the usual choice for the blade for its increased damage and Swordmaster's Guard to reduce the time it takes for your heavy attack to charge. For burst damage against Majors, Relentless Strikes in the first column as the support park refunds ammo after three hits and, after collecting an Elemental pickup you'll have 7s with a 20% boost to damage. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, mkb, controller

// The Title PvE backup roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for minor add clear in endgame activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons . Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong, or Perpetual Motion provides useful, if smaller, boosts as an alternative choice. Similarly with Surrounded as your second column signature perk - although it's not the Enhanced version, you'll still have 40% bonus damage when procced in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Title PvE backup roll
// Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for void synergy minor add clear in general activities. Unfortunately, this doesn't have great stats or any unique perk options by comparison with other aggressive frame SMGs, but drops will rain down during Guardian Games, so that's not unexpected maybe it's just Hakke's unfamiliarity with energy weapons . Season 20 has lost the S-Tier Stats/One for All combination, unfortunately. If you want to tuck one away, push out the range with your barrel and magazine, even at the cost of stability or handling, as we'll be getting that back with the traits, and the Recoil Direction of 85 is pretty much vertical. In the first trait column as your support perk, if you're not proccing Threat Detector's bonus Stability, Handling and Reload Speed, you're just doing it wrong, or Perpetual Motion provides useful, if smaller, boosts as an alternative choice. For void synergy, in the second column signature perk slot, Repulsor Brace provides a void overshield on void debuffed enemy kills - very useful for keeping you alive in CQC. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, if you're up against vehicles and constructs, Hakke Breach Armaments will help burst them down. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Taraxippos PvE backup roll
// Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Zen Moment, Fourth Time's The Charm. Outlaw, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 61 https://open.spotify.com/episode/35xKd0TwFvvOyymsE9Wp5H with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. Backup PvE pick for Strand synergy minor add clear in endgame activities. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Our first Lightweight Strand scout rifle has only one direct kinetic slot competitor in Night Watch, and is pretty comparable in stats, although will do 10% less damage, as a non-kinetic weapon. For min-maxxers, the +30 Mobility from the intrinsic perk can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to tidy up the 54 Recoil Direction. Chambered Compensator or Extended Barrel will get you to a slightly better 64. In the magazine, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both offer useful boosts to stability and reload speed and an extra shot for Tac Mag. If you're still finding the recoil difficult, you can proc all 5 stacks of Zen Moment with just three hits, in the first trait column as your support perk. If you're not finding it a problem, than Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size, or Outlaw works well for a snappy reload after a crit kill. Then Hatchling in the second column as the signature perk builds into the Strand toolkit - just come to peace that they're likely to be spawned too far away to join you, if you're a Warlock. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Rufus's Fury PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Target Lock, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Shapeable. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Rufus's Fury is no different and will be most people's choice for a Strand primary, and will probably only get better when the additional fragments arrive. Although, at 56, the recoil is pretty up-and-down, Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk takes the Recoil Direction to an even more controllable 86 and adds Handling. High-Caliber Rounds or Armor-Piercing Rounds add range and either flinch or overpenetration in the mag. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with signature perks like Target Lock, where the refilled magazine allows you to reach the higher damage stacks, for damage against bulkier enemies or Frenzy for a general 15% damage bump. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Mykel's Reverence PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range and/or Stability in the barrel and use the magazine to add a combat utility perk. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Frenzy as the second column signature perk to effectively extend the magazine and keep the 15% damage boost going. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Reload Speed, Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Mykel's Reverence PvE backup roll
// Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Paracasual Affinity
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. Backup PvE roll for Darkness subclass synergy for Minor add-clearing in end-game content. Most Raid weapons boast stellar stat packages, and Mykel's Reverence is no different - this is the best rapid-fire sidearm. With a Recoil Direction of 96, you can spec into your preference of Range and/or Stability in the barrel and use the magazine to add a combat utility perk. Rewind Rounds is the best of the support perks in the first trait column for primary weapons, pairing with Paracausal Affinity for a 20% damage boost following a kill from any Darkness damage source. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Reccommended MW: Reload Speed, Range, Stability or Handling - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Aurvandil FR6 PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Reconstruction, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2. Backup PvE roll for stasis synergy and end-game content. The first kinetic slot high-impact fusion rifle - it needs handling and stability to improve gunfeel, but it might be worth hanging onto in case the archetype gets a little love. Fusion Rifle range is very constrained, so look for handling with your barrel, and Ionized or Enhanced Battery adds extra shots. Reconstruction then doubles your mag size, and bypasses any reload penalty and means that the top 3/4 of your magazine will now proc Chill Clip. By consistently topping up the magazine you should also benefit from the Omolon origin perk stability boost. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Charge Time, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, swashbuckler, Kill Clip

Backup PvE roll for general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time, or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. As you're likely to be in CQC, Threat Detector should be proccing to provide extra gunfeel stats. In the second trait column, Swashbuckler or Kill Clip are reliable sources of extra damage to keep kill streaks going. // Disparity PvE first-choice roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Rapid Hit, Outlaw, Frenzy, One For All, Swashbuckler, Desperado
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Shapeable. First-choice PvE roll for endgame content. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, or use Hakke Breach Armaments if you're going to face vehicles, turrets or constructs. This is the only currentas at v6.3.0.2 me aggressive frame pulse rifle in the kinetic slot, so it's worth hanging on a good roll.  Correct the wonky recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or Fluted Barrel makes it feel snappier and more stable. In the mag, Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag are the best options, adding more stability and reload speed. Rapid Hit and Outlaw both proc on the on crits, and then match this with your choice of the range of damage output-increasing traits. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. // Stay Frosty PvE backup roll
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE backup roll for end-game match game activities and anti-Barrier Champions when the mod's around. Option of Omolon Fluid Dynamics or the Dawning Surprise origin trait can help you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so. This is the first Stasis Lightweight frame Pulse Rifle, the frame providing +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, and the first to roll with Adaptive Munitions to provide a shield-busting primary in the kinetic slot. Has decent stats compared to kinetic Lightweights. Sort out the wonky recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, and any of the Combat Effect Mag perks or Flared Magwell add utility. In the absence of a complementary column 1 trait, Thresh provides a nice little boost to super regeneration. But the real gold is Adaptive Munitions in trait column 2 for primary ammo shield busting in the kinetic slot for the first time. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Mechabre PvE backup roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Extended Mag, Clown Cartridge, Triple Tap, Vorpal Weapon, High-Impact Reserves
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE backup roll for sustained damage against Bosses. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Direct competitor to Occluded Finality, but with a much more reasonable 45 Zoom. You don't really need to worry about range, so look to boost Handling with the barrel. You want to go all in to the magazine size, so use Extended Barrel and Backup Mag to get to five in the mag. In the first trait column, Clown Cartridge boosts magazine size by up to three on reload, and in the second column, Vorpal Weapon adds 15% damage against Majors, Bosses and vehicles or High-Impact Reserves will add up to 25% bonus damage once you get past the second bullet. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting Boss or Taken Spec mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, Controller, MKB tags:pve, pve-boss, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// The Militia's Birthright PvE backup roll
// Smart Drift Control, Blinding Grenades, Quickdraw, Lead From Gold, Auto-Loading Holster
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 34. PvE backup roll for minor add control in end-game content. Probably only necessary if you've not already got a Blinding Grenade roll on an Ignition Code or Pardon Our Dust. Handling and Velocity are what you need in your barrel, and Blinding Grenades is always great for easier add control, particularly in crowds, and there's a case for both Quickdraw or Lead From Gold in your first trait column, paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the second so that you always have a shot ready. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling - there's really nothing much a mod can add directly as you're not aiming for kills, so maybe Backup Mag mod's increase ammo reserves is the best option, but feel free to plug in what works for you. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Pure Poetry PvE backup roll
// Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Appended Mag, Fourth Time's The Charm, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 32. PvE backup roll for end-game content. Drops from Vanguard activities, so reset your reputation as many times as you have patience for first, to maximise the trait options from decrypting engrams. Maybe not meta as at S18 v6.2.0.6, but Aggressive Frame HCs are always handy for bounties or patrols that call for crit kills, anyway. Good stats overall, slow firing, so stability is less important - add Handling with your barrel and add a few extra bullets with Appended Mag. For your end-game needs, Fourth Times The Charm boosts the magazine provided you can hit crits and Frenzy reliably adds 15% damage. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major, or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// A Sudden Death PvE first-choice roll
// Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Threat Detector, Slideshot Field Prep, Grave Robber, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 25. PvE first-choice roll for end-game content. Stiff competition in the slot from Found Verdict, and suffers by comparison from having no adept version. For clearing heftier minors or groups of majors, choose a barrel that helps with handling or stability, then Assault Mag increases firing rate, or Tactical Mag/ Appended Mag increases mag size to maximum. Then Threat Detector, Grave Robber, Field Prep or Slideshot help to keep you shooting, and Surrounded with the Spec mod adds +40% damage in CQC. Worth pairing with the Heavy Handed Charged With Light Mod for free ammo regeneration on CQC kills. Drops from the final Emissary chest if you're looking to farm it. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Surrounded Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-major, pve-endgame, controller, mkb

// Fang of Ir Yt PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Rewind Rounds, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing chunkier Minor Spec enemies in end-gamecontent. Shapeable. This is the first rapid-fire Strand scout rifle so you get an Alloy Mag-like 20% quicker reload animation when the magazine is empty, with best-in-class stats compared to other RFs in the kinetic slot. The recoil direction is a bit shonky, so Arrowhead Brake cleans that up a bit, but if you feel able to control it, Fluted Barrel adds to handling for general snappiness. You can choose from any of the combat effect rounds as the mag perk, depending on your preference. Rewind Rounds in the first trait column as the support perk works well with new-to-season-22 Precision Instrument in the second as the signature perk to keep the higher damage stacks going for longer, before you reload. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, mkb, controller

// Oversoul Edict Adept PvE first-choice roll
// Arrowhead Brake, Flared Magwell, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Enlightened Action, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 79 https://open.spotify.com/episode/1qz5FD88RfmGHDjedV6nGo?si=7e1c1558ecea4f1c with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Arc synergy add-clear against Minor Spec enemies in general content. Barrel and Mag re-shapeable. Oversoul Edict offers the usual rapid-fire intrinsic 20% faster reload animation when the mag is empty and middling stats by comarison with energy slot peers. Controlling the recoil direction means Arrowhead Brake is the best barrel perk, taking it to an almost not terrible 79. Take your choice of rounding out some of the gunfeel stats with Flared Magwell, or any of the combat effect magazine perks. In the first trait column as the support perk, Enlightened Action will take the base handling to 82 and reload speed to 84 within two bursts, if every shot hits. This will mean a fast reload to proc Voltshot after a kill to apply Jolt on enemies and tie in with your arc verbs. The Cursed Thrall origin perk synergises well with melee builds and is a lot of fun for helping soften up groups of enemies when active. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting Minor or Taken Spec or Backup Mag mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, mkb, controller

// IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 PvE backup roll
// Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Backup PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. It's already an S-Tier stat monster and the Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Not having to worry about stability as much, you might as well push out the range as far as you can for M&KB, and if you're in CQC you want your reload to be as fast as possible - Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell both help out. If you're looking at end-game add-clearing, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit and Surrounded boosts damage by 36.5% and the enhanced version by 47%. But, even though this is a great roll, you'll still know in your heart that you really wanted Voltshot... Recommended  MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting Minor or Taken Spec mod. tags:pve, pve-minor, pve-endgame, mkb

// Eyasluna PvP first-choice roll
// Fastdraw HCS, Ricochet Rounds, Rangefinder, Snapshot Sights
//notes:Inspired by DMB Podcast 263 conversation with @illPhysics. PvP first-choice S-Tier roll for duelling. Arguably the one of the best PvP hand-cannons as at S17, if you're not mainly in the air, anyway - almost feels like you have an additional perk boost in the base stats, and has the highest base stability of any legendary HC. Boost Handling and Stability with our sight and mag. Snapshot Sights still at S17 gets you into ADS in an engagement faster, and Rangefinder improves both your damage and aim assist dropoffs. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Targeting Adjuster mod if you're more passive, Sprint Grip/Quick Access Sling mod if you're more aggressive, or even give Rader Tuner mod a spin. tags:pvp, pvp-duel
